3785  for (Value mapValue : useDevOperands) {
3786  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapValue.getDefiningOp());
3787  Value offloadPtr =
3788  mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() ? mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() : mapOp.getVarPtr();
3789  llvm::Value *origValue = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(offloadPtr);
3790 
3791  // Check if map info is already present for this entry.
3792  if (!findMapInfo(origValue, devInfoTy)) {
3793  mapData.OriginalValue.push_back(origValue);
3794  mapData.Pointers.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue.back());
3795  mapData.IsDeclareTarget.push_back(false);
3796  mapData.BasePointers.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue.back());
3797  mapData.BaseType.push_back(
3798  moduleTranslation.convertType(mapOp.getVarType()));
3799  mapData.Sizes.push_back(builder.getInt64(0));
3800  mapData.MapClause.push_back(mapOp.getOperation());
3801  mapData.Types.push_back(
3802  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_RETURN_PARAM);
3803  mapData.Names.push_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
3804  mapOp.getLoc(), *moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()));
3805  mapData.DevicePointers.push_back(devInfoTy);
3806  mapData.Mappers.push_back(nullptr);
3807  mapData.IsAMapping.push_back(false);
3808  mapData.IsAMember.push_back(checkIsAMember(useDevOperands, mapOp));
3809  }
3810  }
3811  };
3812 
3813  addDevInfos(useDevAddrOperands, llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address);
3814  addDevInfos(useDevPtrOperands, llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer);
3815 
3816  for (Value mapValue : hasDevAddrOperands) {
3817  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapValue.getDefiningOp());
3818  Value offloadPtr =
3819  mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() ? mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() : mapOp.getVarPtr();
3820  llvm::Value *origValue = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(offloadPtr);
3821  auto mapType =
3822  static_cast<llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags>(mapOp.getMapType());
3823  auto mapTypeAlways = llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_ALWAYS;
3824 
3825  mapData.OriginalValue.push_back(origValue);
3826  mapData.BasePointers.push_back(origValue);
3827  mapData.Pointers.push_back(origValue);
3828  mapData.IsDeclareTarget.push_back(false);
3829  mapData.BaseType.push_back(
3830  moduleTranslation.convertType(mapOp.getVarType()));
3831  mapData.Sizes.push_back(
3832  builder.getInt64(dl.getTypeSize(mapOp.getVarType())));
3833  mapData.MapClause.push_back(mapOp.getOperation());
3834  if (llvm::to_underlying(mapType & mapTypeAlways)) {
3835  // Descriptors are mapped with the ALWAYS flag, since they can get
3836  // rematerialized, so the address of the decriptor for a given object
3837  // may change from one place to another.
3838  mapData.Types.push_back(mapType);
3839  // Technically it's possible for a non-descriptor mapping to have
3840  // both has-device-addr and ALWAYS, so lookup the mapper in case it
3841  // exists.
3842  if (mapOp.getMapperId()) {
3843  mapData.Mappers.push_back(
3844  SymbolTable::lookupNearestSymbolFrom<omp::DeclareMapperOp>(
3845  mapOp, mapOp.getMapperIdAttr()));
3846  } else {
3847  mapData.Mappers.push_back(nullptr);
3848  }
3849  } else {
3850  mapData.Types.push_back(
3851  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_LITERAL);
3852  mapData.Mappers.push_back(nullptr);
3853  }
3854  mapData.Names.push_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
3855  mapOp.getLoc(), *moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()));
3856  mapData.DevicePointers.push_back(
3857  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address);
3858  mapData.IsAMapping.push_back(false);
3859  mapData.IsAMember.push_back(checkIsAMember(hasDevAddrOperands, mapOp));
3860  }
3861 }
3862 
3863 static int getMapDataMemberIdx(MapInfoData &mapData, omp::MapInfoOp memberOp) {
3864  auto *res = llvm::find(mapData.MapClause, memberOp);
3865  assert(res != mapData.MapClause.end() &&
3866  "MapInfoOp for member not found in MapData, cannot return index");
3867  return std::distance(mapData.MapClause.begin(), res);
3868 }
3869 
3870 static omp::MapInfoOp getFirstOrLastMappedMemberPtr(omp::MapInfoOp mapInfo,
3871  bool first) {
3872  ArrayAttr indexAttr = mapInfo.getMembersIndexAttr();
3873  // Only 1 member has been mapped, we can return it.
3874  if (indexAttr.size() == 1)
3875  return cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapInfo.getMembers()[0].getDefiningOp());
3876 
3877  llvm::SmallVector<size_t> indices(indexAttr.size());
3878  std::iota(indices.begin(), indices.end(), 0);
3879 
3880  llvm::sort(indices, [&](const size_t a, const size_t b) {
3881  auto memberIndicesA = cast<ArrayAttr>(indexAttr[a]);
3882  auto memberIndicesB = cast<ArrayAttr>(indexAttr[b]);
3883  for (const auto it : llvm::zip(memberIndicesA, memberIndicesB)) {
3884  int64_t aIndex = cast<IntegerAttr>(std::get<0>(it)).getInt();
3885  int64_t bIndex = cast<IntegerAttr>(std::get<1>(it)).getInt();
3886 
3887  if (aIndex == bIndex)
3888  continue;
3889 
3890  if (aIndex < bIndex)
3891  return first;
3892 
3893  if (aIndex > bIndex)
3894  return !first;
3895  }
3896 
3897  // Iterated the up until the end of the smallest member and
3898  // they were found to be equal up to that point, so select
3899  // the member with the lowest index count, so the "parent"
3900  return memberIndicesA.size() < memberIndicesB.size();
3901  });
3902 
3903  return llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(
3904  mapInfo.getMembers()[indices.front()].getDefiningOp());
3905 }
3906 
3907 /// This function calculates the array/pointer offset for map data provided
3908 /// with bounds operations, e.g. when provided something like the following:
3909 ///
3910 /// Fortran
3911 /// map(tofrom: array(2:5, 3:2))
3912 /// or
3913 /// C++
3914 /// map(tofrom: array[1:4][2:3])
3915 /// We must calculate the initial pointer offset to pass across, this function
3916 /// performs this using bounds.
3917 ///
3918 /// NOTE: which while specified in row-major order it currently needs to be
3919 /// flipped for Fortran's column order array allocation and access (as
3920 /// opposed to C++'s row-major, hence the backwards processing where order is
3921 /// important). This is likely important to keep in mind for the future when
3922 /// we incorporate a C++ frontend, both frontends will need to agree on the
3923 /// ordering of generated bounds operations (one may have to flip them) to
3924 /// make the below lowering frontend agnostic. The offload size
3925 /// calcualtion may also have to be adjusted for C++.
3926 std::vector<llvm::Value *>
3927 calculateBoundsOffset(LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
3928  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder, bool isArrayTy,
3929  OperandRange bounds) {
3930  std::vector<llvm::Value *> idx;
3931  // There's no bounds to calculate an offset from, we can safely
3932  // ignore and return no indices.
3933  if (bounds.empty())
3934  return idx;
3935 
3936  // If we have an array type, then we have its type so can treat it as a
3937  // normal GEP instruction where the bounds operations are simply indexes
3938  // into the array. We currently do reverse order of the bounds, which
3939  // I believe leans more towards Fortran's column-major in memory.
3940  if (isArrayTy) {
3941  idx.push_back(builder.getInt64(0));
3942  for (int i = bounds.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
3943  if (auto boundOp = dyn_cast_if_present<omp::MapBoundsOp>(
3944  bounds[i].getDefiningOp())) {
3945  idx.push_back(moduleTranslation.lookupValue(boundOp.getLowerBound()));
3946  }
3947  }
3948  } else {
3949  // If we do not have an array type, but we have bounds, then we're dealing
3950  // with a pointer that's being treated like an array and we have the
3951  // underlying type e.g. an i32, or f64 etc, e.g. a fortran descriptor base
3952  // address (pointer pointing to the actual data) so we must caclulate the
3953  // offset using a single index which the following two loops attempts to
3954  // compute.
3955 
3956  // Calculates the size offset we need to make per row e.g. first row or
3957  // column only needs to be offset by one, but the next would have to be
3958  // the previous row/column offset multiplied by the extent of current row.
3959  //
3960  // For example ([1][10][100]):
3961  //
3962  // - First row/column we move by 1 for each index increment
3963  // - Second row/column we move by 1 (first row/column) * 10 (extent/size of
3964  // current) for 10 for each index increment
3965  // - Third row/column we would move by 10 (second row/column) *
3966  // (extent/size of current) 100 for 1000 for each index increment
3967  std::vector<llvm::Value *> dimensionIndexSizeOffset{builder.getInt64(1)};
3968  for (size_t i = 1; i < bounds.size(); ++i) {
3969  if (auto boundOp = dyn_cast_if_present<omp::MapBoundsOp>(
3970  bounds[i].getDefiningOp())) {
3971  dimensionIndexSizeOffset.push_back(builder.CreateMul(
3972  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(boundOp.getExtent()),
3973  dimensionIndexSizeOffset[i - 1]));
3974  }
3975  }
3976 
3977  // Now that we have calculated how much we move by per index, we must
3978  // multiply each lower bound offset in indexes by the size offset we
3979  // have calculated in the previous and accumulate the results to get
3980  // our final resulting offset.
3981  for (int i = bounds.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
3982  if (auto boundOp = dyn_cast_if_present<omp::MapBoundsOp>(
3983  bounds[i].getDefiningOp())) {
3984  if (idx.empty())
3985  idx.emplace_back(builder.CreateMul(
3986  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(boundOp.getLowerBound()),
3987  dimensionIndexSizeOffset[i]));
3988  else
3989  idx.back() = builder.CreateAdd(
3990  idx.back(), builder.CreateMul(moduleTranslation.lookupValue(
3991  boundOp.getLowerBound()),
3992  dimensionIndexSizeOffset[i]));
3993  }
3994  }
3995  }
3996 
3997  return idx;
3998 }
3999 
4000 // This creates two insertions into the MapInfosTy data structure for the
4001 // "parent" of a set of members, (usually a container e.g.
4002 // class/structure/derived type) when subsequent members have also been
4003 // explicitly mapped on the same map clause. Certain types, such as Fortran
4004 // descriptors are mapped like this as well, however, the members are
4005 // implicit as far as a user is concerned, but we must explicitly map them
4006 // internally.
4007 //
4008 // This function also returns the memberOfFlag for this particular parent,
4009 // which is utilised in subsequent member mappings (by modifying there map type
4010 // with it) to indicate that a member is part of this parent and should be
4011 // treated by the runtime as such. Important to achieve the correct mapping.
4012 //
4013 // This function borrows a lot from Clang's emitCombinedEntry function
4014 // inside of CGOpenMPRuntime.cpp
4015 static llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags mapParentWithMembers(
4016  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4017  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder, DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4018  MapInfoData &mapData, uint64_t mapDataIndex, bool isTargetParams) {
4019  assert(!ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4020  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4021 
4022  // Map the first segment of our structure
4023  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(
4024  isTargetParams
4025  ? llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM
4026  : llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_NONE);
4027  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4028  mapData.DevicePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4029  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(mapData.Mappers[mapDataIndex]);
4030  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
4031  mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]->getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4032  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4033 
4034  // Calculate size of the parent object being mapped based on the
4035  // addresses at runtime, highAddr - lowAddr = size. This of course
4036  // doesn't factor in allocated data like pointers, hence the further
4037  // processing of members specified by users, or in the case of
4038  // Fortran pointers and allocatables, the mapping of the pointed to
4039  // data by the descriptor (which itself, is a structure containing
4040  // runtime information on the dynamically allocated data).
4041  auto parentClause =
4042  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4043 
4044  llvm::Value *lowAddr, *highAddr;
4045  if (!parentClause.getPartialMap()) {
4046  lowAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex],
4047  builder.getPtrTy());
4048  highAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(
4049  builder.CreateConstGEP1_32(mapData.BaseType[mapDataIndex],
4050  mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex], 1),
4051  builder.getPtrTy());
4052  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex]);
4053  } else {
4054  auto mapOp = dyn_cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4055  int firstMemberIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(
4056  mapData, getFirstOrLastMappedMemberPtr(mapOp, true));
4057  lowAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(mapData.Pointers[firstMemberIdx],
4058  builder.getPtrTy());
4059  int lastMemberIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(
4060  mapData, getFirstOrLastMappedMemberPtr(mapOp, false));
4061  highAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(
4062  builder.CreateGEP(mapData.BaseType[lastMemberIdx],
4063  mapData.Pointers[lastMemberIdx], builder.getInt64(1)),
4064  builder.getPtrTy());
4065  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[firstMemberIdx]);
4066  }
4067 
4068  llvm::Value *size = builder.CreateIntCast(
4069  builder.CreatePtrDiff(builder.getInt8Ty(), highAddr, lowAddr),
4070  builder.getInt64Ty(),
4071  /*isSigned=*/false);
4072  combinedInfo.Sizes.push_back(size);
4073 
4074  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags memberOfFlag =
4075  ompBuilder.getMemberOfFlag(combinedInfo.BasePointers.size() - 1);
4076 
4077  // This creates the initial MEMBER_OF mapping that consists of
4078  // the parent/top level container (same as above effectively, except
4079  // with a fixed initial compile time size and separate maptype which
4080  // indicates the true mape type (tofrom etc.). This parent mapping is
4081  // only relevant if the structure in its totality is being mapped,
4082  // otherwise the above suffices.
4083  if (!parentClause.getPartialMap()) {
4084  // TODO: This will need to be expanded to include the whole host of logic
4085  // for the map flags that Clang currently supports (e.g. it should do some
4086  // further case specific flag modifications). For the moment, it handles
4087  // what we support as expected.
4088  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags mapFlag = mapData.Types[mapDataIndex];
4089  ompBuilder.setCorrectMemberOfFlag(mapFlag, memberOfFlag);
4090  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4091  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4092  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::None);
4093  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(nullptr);
4094  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
4095  mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]->getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4096  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4097  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex]);
4098  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(mapData.Sizes[mapDataIndex]);
4099  }
4100  return memberOfFlag;
4101 }
4102 
4103 // The intent is to verify if the mapped data being passed is a
4104 // pointer -> pointee that requires special handling in certain cases,
4105 // e.g. applying the OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ map type.
4106 //
4107 // There may be a better way to verify this, but unfortunately with
4108 // opaque pointers we lose the ability to easily check if something is
4109 // a pointer whilst maintaining access to the underlying type.
4110 static bool checkIfPointerMap(omp::MapInfoOp mapOp) {
4111  // If we have a varPtrPtr field assigned then the underlying type is a pointer
4112  if (mapOp.getVarPtrPtr())
4113  return true;
4114 
4115  // If the map data is declare target with a link clause, then it's represented
4116  // as a pointer when we lower it to LLVM-IR even if at the MLIR level it has
4117  // no relation to pointers.
4118  if (isDeclareTargetLink(mapOp.getVarPtr()))
4119  return true;
4120 
4121  return false;
4122 }
4123 
4124 // This function is intended to add explicit mappings of members
4125 static void processMapMembersWithParent(
4126  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4127  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder, DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4128  MapInfoData &mapData, uint64_t mapDataIndex,
4129  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags memberOfFlag) {
4130  assert(!ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4131  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4132 
4133  auto parentClause =
4134  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4135 
4136  for (auto mappedMembers : parentClause.getMembers()) {
4137  auto memberClause =
4138  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mappedMembers.getDefiningOp());
4139  int memberDataIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(mapData, memberClause);
4140 
4141  assert(memberDataIdx >= 0 && "could not find mapped member of structure");
4142 
4143  // If we're currently mapping a pointer to a block of data, we must
4144  // initially map the pointer, and then attatch/bind the data with a
4145  // subsequent map to the pointer. This segment of code generates the
4146  // pointer mapping, which can in certain cases be optimised out as Clang
4147  // currently does in its lowering. However, for the moment we do not do so,
4148  // in part as we currently have substantially less information on the data
4149  // being mapped at this stage.
4150  if (checkIfPointerMap(memberClause)) {
4151  auto mapFlag =
4152  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags(memberClause.getMapType());
4153  mapFlag &= ~llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM;
4154  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_MEMBER_OF;
4155  ompBuilder.setCorrectMemberOfFlag(mapFlag, memberOfFlag);
4156  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4157  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4158  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::None);
4159  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(nullptr);
4160  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(
4161  LLVM::createMappingInformation(memberClause.getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4162  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(
4163  mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4164  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[memberDataIdx]);
4165  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(builder.getInt64(
4166  moduleTranslation.getLLVMModule()->getDataLayout().getPointerSize()));
4167  }
4168 
4169  // Same MemberOfFlag to indicate its link with parent and other members
4170  // of.
4171  auto mapFlag =
4172  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags(memberClause.getMapType());
4173  mapFlag &= ~llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM;
4174  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_MEMBER_OF;
4175  ompBuilder.setCorrectMemberOfFlag(mapFlag, memberOfFlag);
4176  if (checkIfPointerMap(memberClause))
4177  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ;
4178 
4179  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4180  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4181  mapData.DevicePointers[memberDataIdx]);
4182  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(mapData.Mappers[memberDataIdx]);
4183  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(
4184  LLVM::createMappingInformation(memberClause.getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4185  uint64_t basePointerIndex =
4186  checkIfPointerMap(memberClause) ? memberDataIdx : mapDataIndex;
4187  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(
4188  mapData.BasePointers[basePointerIndex]);
4189  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[memberDataIdx]);
4190 
4191  llvm::Value *size = mapData.Sizes[memberDataIdx];
4192  if (checkIfPointerMap(memberClause)) {
4193  size = builder.CreateSelect(
4194  builder.CreateIsNull(mapData.Pointers[memberDataIdx]),
4195  builder.getInt64(0), size);
4196  }
4197 
4198  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(size);
4199  }
4200 }
4201 
4202 static void processIndividualMap(MapInfoData &mapData, size_t mapDataIdx,
4203  MapInfosTy &combinedInfo, bool isTargetParams,
4204  int mapDataParentIdx = -1) {
4205  // Declare Target Mappings are excluded from being marked as
4206  // OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM as they are not passed as parameters, they're
4207  // marked with OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ instead.
4208  auto mapFlag = mapData.Types[mapDataIdx];
4209  auto mapInfoOp = llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIdx]);
4210 
4211  bool isPtrTy = checkIfPointerMap(mapInfoOp);
4212  if (isPtrTy)
4213  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ;
4214 
4215  if (isTargetParams && !mapData.IsDeclareTarget[mapDataIdx])
4216  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM;
4217 
4218  if (mapInfoOp.getMapCaptureType() == omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByCopy &&
4219  !isPtrTy)
4220  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_LITERAL;
4221 
4222  // if we're provided a mapDataParentIdx, then the data being mapped is
4223  // part of a larger object (in a parent <-> member mapping) and in this
4224  // case our BasePointer should be the parent.
4225  if (mapDataParentIdx >= 0)
4226  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(
4227  mapData.BasePointers[mapDataParentIdx]);
4228  else
4229  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIdx]);
4230 
4231  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIdx]);
4232  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(mapData.DevicePointers[mapDataIdx]);
4233  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(mapData.Mappers[mapDataIdx]);
4234  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(mapData.Names[mapDataIdx]);
4235  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4236  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(mapData.Sizes[mapDataIdx]);
4237 }
4238 
4239 static void processMapWithMembersOf(LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4240  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4241  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder,
4242  DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4243  MapInfoData &mapData, uint64_t mapDataIndex,
4244  bool isTargetParams) {
4245  assert(!ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4246  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4247 
4248  auto parentClause =
4249  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4250 
4251  // If we have a partial map (no parent referenced in the map clauses of the
4252  // directive, only members) and only a single member, we do not need to bind
4253  // the map of the member to the parent, we can pass the member separately.
4254  if (parentClause.getMembers().size() == 1 && parentClause.getPartialMap()) {
4255  auto memberClause = llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(
4256  parentClause.getMembers()[0].getDefiningOp());
4257  int memberDataIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(mapData, memberClause);
4258  // Note: Clang treats arrays with explicit bounds that fall into this
4259  // category as a parent with map case, however, it seems this isn't a
4260  // requirement, and processing them as an individual map is fine. So,
4261  // we will handle them as individual maps for the moment, as it's
4262  // difficult for us to check this as we always require bounds to be
4263  // specified currently and it's also marginally more optimal (single
4264  // map rather than two). The difference may come from the fact that
4265  // Clang maps array without bounds as pointers (which we do not
4266  // currently do), whereas we treat them as arrays in all cases
4267  // currently.
4268  processIndividualMap(mapData, memberDataIdx, combinedInfo, isTargetParams,
4269  mapDataIndex);
4270  return;
4271  }
4272 
4273  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags memberOfParentFlag =
4274  mapParentWithMembers(moduleTranslation, builder, ompBuilder, dl,
4275  combinedInfo, mapData, mapDataIndex, isTargetParams);
4276  processMapMembersWithParent(moduleTranslation, builder, ompBuilder, dl,
4277  combinedInfo, mapData, mapDataIndex,
4278  memberOfParentFlag);
4279 }
4280 
4281 // This is a variation on Clang's GenerateOpenMPCapturedVars, which
4282 // generates different operation (e.g. load/store) combinations for
4283 // arguments to the kernel, based on map capture kinds which are then
4284 // utilised in the combinedInfo in place of the original Map value.
4285 static void
4286 createAlteredByCaptureMap(MapInfoData &mapData,
4287  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4288  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder) {
4289  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4290  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4291  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i) {
4292  // if it's declare target, skip it, it's handled separately.
4293  if (!mapData.IsDeclareTarget[i]) {
4294  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[i]);
4295  omp::VariableCaptureKind captureKind = mapOp.getMapCaptureType();
4296  bool isPtrTy = checkIfPointerMap(mapOp);
4297 
4298  // Currently handles array sectioning lowerbound case, but more
4299  // logic may be required in the future. Clang invokes EmitLValue,
4300  // which has specialised logic for special Clang types such as user
4301  // defines, so it is possible we will have to extend this for
4302  // structures or other complex types. As the general idea is that this
4303  // function mimics some of the logic from Clang that we require for
4304  // kernel argument passing from host -> device.
4305  switch (captureKind) {
4306  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByRef: {
4307  llvm::Value *newV = mapData.Pointers[i];
4308  std::vector<llvm::Value *> offsetIdx = calculateBoundsOffset(
4309  moduleTranslation, builder, mapData.BaseType[i]->isArrayTy(),
4310  mapOp.getBounds());
4311  if (isPtrTy)
4312  newV = builder.CreateLoad(builder.getPtrTy(), newV);
4313 
4314  if (!offsetIdx.empty())
4315  newV = builder.CreateInBoundsGEP(mapData.BaseType[i], newV, offsetIdx,
4316  "array_offset");
4317  mapData.Pointers[i] = newV;
4318  } break;
4319  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByCopy: {
4320  llvm::Type *type = mapData.BaseType[i];
4321  llvm::Value *newV;
4322  if (mapData.Pointers[i]->getType()->isPointerTy())
4323  newV = builder.CreateLoad(type, mapData.Pointers[i]);
4324  else
4325  newV = mapData.Pointers[i];
4326 
4327  if (!isPtrTy) {
4328  auto curInsert = builder.saveIP();
4329  builder.restoreIP(findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation));
4330  auto *memTempAlloc =
4331  builder.CreateAlloca(builder.getPtrTy(), nullptr, ".casted");
4332  builder.restoreIP(curInsert);
4333 
4334  builder.CreateStore(newV, memTempAlloc);
4335  newV = builder.CreateLoad(builder.getPtrTy(), memTempAlloc);
4336  }
4337 
4338  mapData.Pointers[i] = newV;
4339  mapData.BasePointers[i] = newV;
4340  } break;
4341  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::This:
4342  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::VLAType:
4343  mapData.MapClause[i]->emitOpError("Unhandled capture kind");
4344  break;
4345  }
4346  }
4347  }
4348 }
4349 
4350 // Generate all map related information and fill the combinedInfo.
4351 static void genMapInfos(llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4352  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4353  DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4354  MapInfoData &mapData, bool isTargetParams = false) {
4355  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4356  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4357 
4358  // We wish to modify some of the methods in which arguments are
4359  // passed based on their capture type by the target region, this can
4360  // involve generating new loads and stores, which changes the
4361  // MLIR value to LLVM value mapping, however, we only wish to do this
4362  // locally for the current function/target and also avoid altering
4363  // ModuleTranslation, so we remap the base pointer or pointer stored
4364  // in the map infos corresponding MapInfoData, which is later accessed
4365  // by genMapInfos and createTarget to help generate the kernel and
4366  // kernel arg structure. It primarily becomes relevant in cases like
4367  // bycopy, or byref range'd arrays. In the default case, we simply
4368  // pass thee pointer byref as both basePointer and pointer.
4369  createAlteredByCaptureMap(mapData, moduleTranslation, builder);
4370 
4371  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4372 
4373  // We operate under the assumption that all vectors that are
4374  // required in MapInfoData are of equal lengths (either filled with
4375  // default constructed data or appropiate information) so we can
4376  // utilise the size from any component of MapInfoData, if we can't
4377  // something is missing from the initial MapInfoData construction.
4378  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i) {
4379  // NOTE/TODO: We currently do not support arbitrary depth record
4380  // type mapping.
4381  if (mapData.IsAMember[i])
4382  continue;
4383 
4384  auto mapInfoOp = dyn_cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[i]);
4385  if (!mapInfoOp.getMembers().empty()) {
4386  processMapWithMembersOf(moduleTranslation, builder, *ompBuilder, dl,
4387  combinedInfo, mapData, i, isTargetParams);
4388  continue;
4389  }
4390 
4391  processIndividualMap(mapData, i, combinedInfo, isTargetParams);
4392  }
4393 }
4394 
4395 static llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *>
4396 emitUserDefinedMapper(Operation *declMapperOp, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4397  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4398  llvm::StringRef mapperFuncName);
4399 
4400 static llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *>
4401 getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4402  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4403  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4404  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4405  auto declMapperOp = cast<omp::DeclareMapperOp>(op);
4406  std::string mapperFuncName =
4407  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->createPlatformSpecificName(
4408  {"omp_mapper", declMapperOp.getSymName()});
4409 
4410  if (auto *lookupFunc = moduleTranslation.lookupFunction(mapperFuncName))
4411  return lookupFunc;
4412 
4413  return emitUserDefinedMapper(declMapperOp, builder, moduleTranslation,
4414  mapperFuncName);
4415 }
4416 
4417 static llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *>
4418 emitUserDefinedMapper(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4419  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4420  llvm::StringRef mapperFuncName) {
4421  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4422  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4423  auto declMapperOp = cast<omp::DeclareMapperOp>(op);
4424  auto declMapperInfoOp = declMapperOp.getDeclareMapperInfo();
4425  DataLayout dl = DataLayout(declMapperOp->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
4426  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4427  llvm::Type *varType = moduleTranslation.convertType(declMapperOp.getType());
4428  SmallVector<Value> mapVars = declMapperInfoOp.getMapVars();
4429 
4430  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
4431 
4432  // Fill up the arrays with all the mapped variables.
4433  MapInfosTy combinedInfo;
4434  auto genMapInfoCB =
4435  [&](InsertPointTy codeGenIP, llvm::Value *ptrPHI,
4436  llvm::Value *unused2) -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::MapInfosOrErrorTy {
4437  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4438  moduleTranslation.mapValue(declMapperOp.getSymVal(), ptrPHI);
4439  moduleTranslation.mapBlock(&declMapperOp.getRegion().front(),
4440  builder.GetInsertBlock());
4441  if (failed(moduleTranslation.convertBlock(declMapperOp.getRegion().front(),
4442  /*ignoreArguments=*/true,
4443  builder)))
4444  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4445  MapInfoData mapData;
4446  collectMapDataFromMapOperands(mapData, mapVars, moduleTranslation, dl,
4447  builder);
4448  genMapInfos(builder, moduleTranslation, dl, combinedInfo, mapData);
4449 
4450  // Drop the mapping that is no longer necessary so that the same region can
4451  // be processed multiple times.
4452  moduleTranslation.forgetMapping(declMapperOp.getRegion());
4453  return combinedInfo;
4454  };
4455 
4456  auto customMapperCB = [&](unsigned i) -> llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> {
4457  if (!combinedInfo.Mappers[i])
4458  return nullptr;
4459  return getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(combinedInfo.Mappers[i], builder,
4460  moduleTranslation);
4461  };
4462 
4463  llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> newFn = ompBuilder->emitUserDefinedMapper(
4464  genMapInfoCB, varType, mapperFuncName, customMapperCB);
4465  if (!newFn)
4466  return newFn.takeError();
4467  moduleTranslation.mapFunction(mapperFuncName, *newFn);
4468  return *newFn;
4469 }
4470 
4471 static LogicalResult
4472 convertOmpTargetData(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4473  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4474  llvm::Value *ifCond = nullptr;
4475  int64_t deviceID = llvm::omp::OMP_DEVICEID_UNDEF;
4476  SmallVector<Value> mapVars;
4477  SmallVector<Value> useDevicePtrVars;
4478  SmallVector<Value> useDeviceAddrVars;
4479  llvm::omp::RuntimeFunction RTLFn;
4480  DataLayout DL = DataLayout(op->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
4481 
4482  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4483  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetDataInfo info(/*RequiresDevicePointerInfo=*/true,
4484  /*SeparateBeginEndCalls=*/true);
4485  bool isTargetDevice = ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice();
4486  bool isOffloadEntry =
4487  isTargetDevice || !ompBuilder->Config.TargetTriples.empty();
4488 
4489  LogicalResult result =
4490  llvm::TypeSwitch<Operation *, LogicalResult>(op)
4491  .Case([&](omp::TargetDataOp dataOp) {
4492  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*dataOp)))
4493  return failure();
4494 
4495  if (auto ifVar = dataOp.getIfExpr())
4496  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4497 
4498  if (auto devId = dataOp.getDevice())
4499  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4500  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4501  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4502 
4503  mapVars = dataOp.getMapVars();
4504  useDevicePtrVars = dataOp.getUseDevicePtrVars();
4505  useDeviceAddrVars = dataOp.getUseDeviceAddrVars();
4506  return success();
4507  })
4508  .Case([&](omp::TargetEnterDataOp enterDataOp) -> LogicalResult {
4509  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*enterDataOp)))
4510  return failure();
4511 
4512  if (auto ifVar = enterDataOp.getIfExpr())
4513  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4514 
4515  if (auto devId = enterDataOp.getDevice())
4516  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4517  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4518  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4519  RTLFn =
4520  enterDataOp.getNowait()
4521  ? llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_begin_nowait_mapper
4522  : llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_begin_mapper;
4523  mapVars = enterDataOp.getMapVars();
4524  info.HasNoWait = enterDataOp.getNowait();
4525  return success();
4526  })
4527  .Case([&](omp::TargetExitDataOp exitDataOp) -> LogicalResult {
4528  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*exitDataOp)))
4529  return failure();
4530 
4531  if (auto ifVar = exitDataOp.getIfExpr())
4532  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4533 
4534  if (auto devId = exitDataOp.getDevice())
4535  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4536  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4537  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4538 
4539  RTLFn = exitDataOp.getNowait()
4540  ? llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_end_nowait_mapper
4541  : llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_end_mapper;
4542  mapVars = exitDataOp.getMapVars();
4543  info.HasNoWait = exitDataOp.getNowait();
4544  return success();
4545  })
4546  .Case([&](omp::TargetUpdateOp updateDataOp) -> LogicalResult {
4547  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*updateDataOp)))
4548  return failure();
4549 
4550  if (auto ifVar = updateDataOp.getIfExpr())
4551  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4552 
4553  if (auto devId = updateDataOp.getDevice())
4554  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4555  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4556  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4557 
4558  RTLFn =
4559  updateDataOp.getNowait()
4560  ? llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_update_nowait_mapper
4561  : llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_update_mapper;
4562  mapVars = updateDataOp.getMapVars();
4563  info.HasNoWait = updateDataOp.getNowait();
4564  return success();
4565  })
4566  .Default([&](Operation *op) {
4567  llvm_unreachable("unexpected operation");
4568  return failure();
4569  });
4570 
4571  if (failed(result))
4572  return failure();
4573  // Pretend we have IF(false) if we're not doing offload.
4574  if (!isOffloadEntry)
4575  ifCond = builder.getFalse();
4576 
4577  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
4578  MapInfoData mapData;
4579  collectMapDataFromMapOperands(mapData, mapVars, moduleTranslation, DL,
4580  builder, useDevicePtrVars, useDeviceAddrVars);
4581 
4582  // Fill up the arrays with all the mapped variables.
4583  MapInfosTy combinedInfo;
4584  auto genMapInfoCB = [&](InsertPointTy codeGenIP) -> MapInfosTy & {
4585  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4586  genMapInfos(builder, moduleTranslation, DL, combinedInfo, mapData);
4587  return combinedInfo;
4588  };
4589 
4590  // Define a lambda to apply mappings between use_device_addr and
4591  // use_device_ptr base pointers, and their associated block arguments.
4592  auto mapUseDevice =
4593  [&moduleTranslation](
4594  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy type,
4595  llvm::ArrayRef<BlockArgument> blockArgs,
4596  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> &useDeviceVars, MapInfoData &mapInfoData,
4597  llvm::function_ref<llvm::Value *(llvm::Value *)> mapper = nullptr) {
4598  for (auto [arg, useDevVar] :
4599  llvm::zip_equal(blockArgs, useDeviceVars)) {
4600 
4601  auto getMapBasePtr = [](omp::MapInfoOp mapInfoOp) {
4602  return mapInfoOp.getVarPtrPtr() ? mapInfoOp.getVarPtrPtr()
4603  : mapInfoOp.getVarPtr();
4604  };
4605 
4606  auto useDevMap = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(useDevVar.getDefiningOp());
4607  for (auto [mapClause, devicePointer, basePointer] : llvm::zip_equal(
4608  mapInfoData.MapClause, mapInfoData.DevicePointers,
4609  mapInfoData.BasePointers)) {
4610  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapClause);
4611  if (getMapBasePtr(mapOp) != getMapBasePtr(useDevMap) ||
4612  devicePointer != type)
4613  continue;
4614 
4615  if (llvm::Value *devPtrInfoMap =
4616  mapper ? mapper(basePointer) : basePointer) {
4617  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, devPtrInfoMap);
4618  break;
4619  }
4620  }
4621  }
4622  };
4623 
4624  using BodyGenTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::BodyGenTy;
4625  auto bodyGenCB = [&](InsertPointTy codeGenIP, BodyGenTy bodyGenType)
4626  -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy {
4627  // We must always restoreIP regardless of doing anything the caller
4628  // does not restore it, leading to incorrect (no) branch generation.
4629  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4630  assert(isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(op) &&
4631  "BodyGen requested for non TargetDataOp");
4632  auto blockArgIface = cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(op);
4633  Region &region = cast<omp::TargetDataOp>(op).getRegion();
4634  switch (bodyGenType) {
4635  case BodyGenTy::Priv:
4636  // Check if any device ptr/addr info is available
4637  if (!info.DevicePtrInfoMap.empty()) {
4638  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address,
4639  blockArgIface.getUseDeviceAddrBlockArgs(),
4640  useDeviceAddrVars, mapData,
4641  [&](llvm::Value *basePointer) -> llvm::Value * {
4642  if (!info.DevicePtrInfoMap[basePointer].second)
4643  return nullptr;
4644  return builder.CreateLoad(
4645  builder.getPtrTy(),
4646  info.DevicePtrInfoMap[basePointer].second);
4647  });
4648  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer,
4649  blockArgIface.getUseDevicePtrBlockArgs(), useDevicePtrVars,
4650  mapData, [&](llvm::Value *basePointer) {
4651  return info.DevicePtrInfoMap[basePointer].second;
4652  });
4653 
4654  if (failed(inlineConvertOmpRegions(region, "omp.data.region", builder,
4655  moduleTranslation)))
4656  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4657  }
4658  break;
4659  case BodyGenTy::DupNoPriv:
4660  if (info.DevicePtrInfoMap.empty()) {
4661  // For host device we still need to do the mapping for codegen,
4662  // otherwise it may try to lookup a missing value.
4663  if (!ompBuilder->Config.IsTargetDevice.value_or(false)) {
4664  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address,
4665  blockArgIface.getUseDeviceAddrBlockArgs(),
4666  useDeviceAddrVars, mapData);
4667  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer,
4668  blockArgIface.getUseDevicePtrBlockArgs(),
4669  useDevicePtrVars, mapData);
4670  }
4671  }
4672  break;
4673  case BodyGenTy::NoPriv:
4674  // If device info is available then region has already been generated
4675  if (info.DevicePtrInfoMap.empty()) {
4676  // For device pass, if use_device_ptr(addr) mappings were present,
4677  // we need to link them here before codegen.
4678  if (ompBuilder->Config.IsTargetDevice.value_or(false)) {
4679  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address,
4680  blockArgIface.getUseDeviceAddrBlockArgs(),
4681  useDeviceAddrVars, mapData);
4682  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer,
4683  blockArgIface.getUseDevicePtrBlockArgs(),
4684  useDevicePtrVars, mapData);
4685  }
4686 
4687  if (failed(inlineConvertOmpRegions(region, "omp.data.region", builder,
4688  moduleTranslation)))
4689  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4690  }
4691  break;
4692  }
4693  return builder.saveIP();
4694  };
4695 
4696  auto customMapperCB =
4697  [&](unsigned int i) -> llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> {
4698  if (!combinedInfo.Mappers[i])
4699  return nullptr;
4700  info.HasMapper = true;
4701  return getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(combinedInfo.Mappers[i], builder,
4702  moduleTranslation);
4703  };
4704 
4705  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
4706  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
4707  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
4708  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP = [&]() {
4709  if (isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(op))
4710  return ompBuilder->createTargetData(ompLoc, allocaIP, builder.saveIP(),
4711  builder.getInt64(deviceID), ifCond,
4712  info, genMapInfoCB, customMapperCB,
4713  /*MapperFunc=*/nullptr, bodyGenCB,
4714  /*DeviceAddrCB=*/nullptr);
4715  return ompBuilder->createTargetData(
4716  ompLoc, allocaIP, builder.saveIP(), builder.getInt64(deviceID), ifCond,
4717  info, genMapInfoCB, customMapperCB, &RTLFn);
4718  }();
4719 
4720  if (failed(handleError(afterIP, *op)))
4721  return failure();
4722 
4723  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
4724  return success();
4725 }
4726 
4727 static LogicalResult
4728 convertOmpDistribute(Operation &opInst, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4729  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4730  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4731  auto distributeOp = cast<omp::DistributeOp>(opInst);
4732  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(opInst)))
4733  return failure();
4734 
4735  /// Process teams op reduction in distribute if the reduction is contained in
4736  /// the distribute op.
4737  omp::TeamsOp teamsOp = opInst.getParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>();
4738  bool doDistributeReduction =
4739  teamsOp ? teamsReductionContainedInDistribute(teamsOp) : false;
4740 
4741  DenseMap<Value, llvm::Value *> reductionVariableMap;
4742  unsigned numReductionVars = teamsOp ? teamsOp.getNumReductionVars() : 0;
4743  SmallVector<omp::DeclareReductionOp> reductionDecls;
4744  SmallVector<llvm::Value *> privateReductionVariables(numReductionVars);
4745  llvm::ArrayRef<bool> isByRef;
4746 
4747  if (doDistributeReduction) {
4748  isByRef = getIsByRef(teamsOp.getReductionByref());
4749  assert(isByRef.size() == teamsOp.getNumReductionVars());
4750 
4751  collectReductionDecls(teamsOp, reductionDecls);
4752  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
4753  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
4754 
4755  MutableArrayRef<BlockArgument> reductionArgs =
4756  llvm::cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(*teamsOp)
4757  .getReductionBlockArgs();
4758 
4759  if (failed(allocAndInitializeReductionVars(
4760  teamsOp, reductionArgs, builder, moduleTranslation, allocaIP,
4761  reductionDecls, privateReductionVariables, reductionVariableMap,
4762  isByRef)))
4763  return failure();
4764  }
4765 
4766  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
4767  auto bodyGenCB = [&](InsertPointTy allocaIP,
4768  InsertPointTy codeGenIP) -> llvm::Error {
4769  // Save the alloca insertion point on ModuleTranslation stack for use in
4770  // nested regions.
4771  LLVM::ModuleTranslation::SaveStack<OpenMPAllocaStackFrame> frame(
4772  moduleTranslation, allocaIP);
4773 
4774  // DistributeOp has only one region associated with it.
4775  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4776  PrivateVarsInfo privVarsInfo(distributeOp);
4777 
4778  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> afterAllocas =
4779  allocatePrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privVarsInfo, allocaIP);
4780  if (handleError(afterAllocas, opInst).failed())
4781  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4782 
4783  if (handleError(initPrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privVarsInfo),
4784  opInst)
4785  .failed())
4786  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4787 
4788  if (failed(copyFirstPrivateVars(
4789  distributeOp, builder, moduleTranslation, privVarsInfo.mlirVars,
4790  privVarsInfo.llvmVars, privVarsInfo.privatizers,
4791  distributeOp.getPrivateNeedsBarrier())))
4792  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4793 
4794  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4795  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
4796  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> regionBlock =
4797  convertOmpOpRegions(distributeOp.getRegion(), "omp.distribute.region",
4798  builder, moduleTranslation);
4799  if (!regionBlock)
4800  return regionBlock.takeError();
4801  builder.SetInsertPoint(*regionBlock, (*regionBlock)->begin());
4802 
4803  // Skip applying a workshare loop below when translating 'distribute
4804  // parallel do' (it's been already handled by this point while translating
4805  // the nested omp.wsloop).
4806  if (!isa_and_present<omp::WsloopOp>(distributeOp.getNestedWrapper())) {
4807  // TODO: Add support for clauses which are valid for DISTRIBUTE
4808  // constructs. Static schedule is the default.
4809  auto schedule = omp::ClauseScheduleKind::Static;
4810  bool isOrdered = false;
4811  std::optional<omp::ScheduleModifier> scheduleMod;
4812  bool isSimd = false;
4813  llvm::omp::WorksharingLoopType workshareLoopType =
4814  llvm::omp::WorksharingLoopType::DistributeStaticLoop;
4815  bool loopNeedsBarrier = false;
4816  llvm::Value *chunk = nullptr;
4817 
4818  llvm::CanonicalLoopInfo *loopInfo =
4819  findCurrentLoopInfo(moduleTranslation);
4820  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy wsloopIP =
4821  ompBuilder->applyWorkshareLoop(
4822  ompLoc.DL, loopInfo, allocaIP, loopNeedsBarrier,
4823  convertToScheduleKind(schedule), chunk, isSimd,
4824  scheduleMod == omp::ScheduleModifier::monotonic,
4825  scheduleMod == omp::ScheduleModifier::nonmonotonic, isOrdered,
4826  workshareLoopType);
4827 
4828  if (!wsloopIP)
4829  return wsloopIP.takeError();
4830  }
4831 
4832  if (failed(cleanupPrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation,
4833  distributeOp.getLoc(), privVarsInfo.llvmVars,
4834  privVarsInfo.privatizers)))
4835  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4836 
4837  return llvm::Error::success();
4838  };
4839 
4840  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
4841  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
4842  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
4843  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP =
4844  ompBuilder->createDistribute(ompLoc, allocaIP, bodyGenCB);
4845 
4846  if (failed(handleError(afterIP, opInst)))
4847  return failure();
4848 
4849  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
4850 
4851  if (doDistributeReduction) {
4852  // Process the reductions if required.
4853  return createReductionsAndCleanup(
4854  teamsOp, builder, moduleTranslation, allocaIP, reductionDecls,
4855  privateReductionVariables, isByRef,
4856  /*isNoWait*/ false, /*isTeamsReduction*/ true);
4857  }
4858  return success();
4859 }
4860 
4861 /// Lowers the FlagsAttr which is applied to the module on the device
4862 /// pass when offloading, this attribute contains OpenMP RTL globals that can
4863 /// be passed as flags to the frontend, otherwise they are set to default
4864 LogicalResult convertFlagsAttr(Operation *op, mlir::omp::FlagsAttr attribute,
4865  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4866  if (!cast<mlir::ModuleOp>(op))
4867  return failure();
4868 
4869  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4870 
4871  ompBuilder->M.addModuleFlag(llvm::Module::Max, "openmp-device",
4872  attribute.getOpenmpDeviceVersion());
4873 
4874  if (attribute.getNoGpuLib())
4875  return success();
4876 
4877  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
4878  attribute.getDebugKind() /*LangOpts().OpenMPTargetDebug*/,
4879  "__omp_rtl_debug_kind");
4880  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
4881  attribute
4882  .getAssumeTeamsOversubscription() /*LangOpts().OpenMPTeamSubscription*/
4883  ,
4884  "__omp_rtl_assume_teams_oversubscription");
4885  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
4886  attribute
4887  .getAssumeThreadsOversubscription() /*LangOpts().OpenMPThreadSubscription*/
4888  ,
4889  "__omp_rtl_assume_threads_oversubscription");
4890  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
4891  attribute.getAssumeNoThreadState() /*LangOpts().OpenMPNoThreadState*/,
4892  "__omp_rtl_assume_no_thread_state");
4893  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
4894  attribute
4895  .getAssumeNoNestedParallelism() /*LangOpts().OpenMPNoNestedParallelism*/
4896  ,
4897  "__omp_rtl_assume_no_nested_parallelism");
4898  return success();
4899 }
4900 
4901 static void getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo &targetInfo,
4902  omp::TargetOp targetOp,
4903  llvm::StringRef parentName = "") {
4904  auto fileLoc = targetOp.getLoc()->findInstanceOf<FileLineColLoc>();
4905 
4906  assert(fileLoc && "No file found from location");
4907  StringRef fileName = fileLoc.getFilename().getValue();
4908 
4909  llvm::sys::fs::UniqueID id;
4910  uint64_t line = fileLoc.getLine();
4911  if (auto ec = llvm::sys::fs::getUniqueID(fileName, id)) {
4912  size_t fileHash = llvm::hash_value(fileName.str());
4913  size_t deviceId = 0xdeadf17e;
4914  targetInfo =
4915  llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo(parentName, deviceId, fileHash, line);
4916  } else {
4917  targetInfo = llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo(parentName, id.getDevice(),
4918  id.getFile(), line);
4919  }
4920 }
4921 
4922 static void
4923 handleDeclareTargetMapVar(MapInfoData &mapData,
4924  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4925  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder, llvm::Function *func) {
4926  assert(moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4927  "function only supported for target device codegen");
4928  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPointGuard guard(builder);
4929  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i) {
4930  // In the case of declare target mapped variables, the basePointer is
4931  // the reference pointer generated by the convertDeclareTargetAttr
4932  // method. Whereas the kernelValue is the original variable, so for
4933  // the device we must replace all uses of this original global variable
4934  // (stored in kernelValue) with the reference pointer (stored in
4935  // basePointer for declare target mapped variables), as for device the
4936  // data is mapped into this reference pointer and should be loaded
4937  // from it, the original variable is discarded. On host both exist and
4938  // metadata is generated (elsewhere in the convertDeclareTargetAttr)
4939  // function to link the two variables in the runtime and then both the
4940  // reference pointer and the pointer are assigned in the kernel argument
4941  // structure for the host.
4942  if (mapData.IsDeclareTarget[i]) {
4943  // If the original map value is a constant, then we have to make sure all
4944  // of it's uses within the current kernel/function that we are going to
4945  // rewrite are converted to instructions, as we will be altering the old
4946  // use (OriginalValue) from a constant to an instruction, which will be
4947  // illegal and ICE the compiler if the user is a constant expression of
4948  // some kind e.g. a constant GEP.
4949  if (auto *constant = dyn_cast<llvm::Constant>(mapData.OriginalValue[i]))
4950  convertUsersOfConstantsToInstructions(constant, func, false);
4951 
4952  // The users iterator will get invalidated if we modify an element,
4953  // so we populate this vector of uses to alter each user on an
4954  // individual basis to emit its own load (rather than one load for
4955  // all).
4956  llvm::SmallVector<llvm::User *> userVec;
4957  for (llvm::User *user : mapData.OriginalValue[i]->users())
4958  userVec.push_back(user);
4959 
4960  for (llvm::User *user : userVec) {
4961  if (auto *insn = dyn_cast<llvm::Instruction>(user)) {
4962  if (insn->getFunction() == func) {
4963  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(insn->getDebugLoc());
4964  auto *load = builder.CreateLoad(mapData.BasePointers[i]->getType(),
4965  mapData.BasePointers[i]);
4966  load->moveBefore(insn->getIterator());
4967  user->replaceUsesOfWith(mapData.OriginalValue[i], load);
4968  }
4969  }
4970  }
4971  }
4972  }
4973 }
4974 
4975 // The createDeviceArgumentAccessor function generates
4976 // instructions for retrieving (acessing) kernel
4977 // arguments inside of the device kernel for use by
4978 // the kernel. This enables different semantics such as
4979 // the creation of temporary copies of data allowing
4980 // semantics like read-only/no host write back kernel
4981 // arguments.
4982 //
4983 // This currently implements a very light version of Clang's
4984 // EmitParmDecl's handling of direct argument handling as well
4985 // as a portion of the argument access generation based on
4986 // capture types found at the end of emitOutlinedFunctionPrologue
4987 // in Clang. The indirect path handling of EmitParmDecl's may be
4988 // required for future work, but a direct 1-to-1 copy doesn't seem
4989 // possible as the logic is rather scattered throughout Clang's
4990 // lowering and perhaps we wish to deviate slightly.
4991 //
4992 // \param mapData - A container containing vectors of information
4993 // corresponding to the input argument, which should have a
4994 // corresponding entry in the MapInfoData containers
4995 // OrigialValue's.
4996 // \param arg - This is the generated kernel function argument that
4997 // corresponds to the passed in input argument. We generated different
4998 // accesses of this Argument, based on capture type and other Input
4999 // related information.
5000 // \param input - This is the host side value that will be passed to
5001 // the kernel i.e. the kernel input, we rewrite all uses of this within
5002 // the kernel (as we generate the kernel body based on the target's region
5003 // which maintians references to the original input) to the retVal argument
5004 // apon exit of this function inside of the OMPIRBuilder. This interlinks
5005 // the kernel argument to future uses of it in the function providing
5006 // appropriate "glue" instructions inbetween.
5007 // \param retVal - This is the value that all uses of input inside of the
5008 // kernel will be re-written to, the goal of this function is to generate
5009 // an appropriate location for the kernel argument to be accessed from,
5010 // e.g. ByRef will result in a temporary allocation location and then
5011 // a store of the kernel argument into this allocated memory which
5012 // will then be loaded from, ByCopy will use the allocated memory
5013 // directly.
5014 static llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPoint
5015 createDeviceArgumentAccessor(MapInfoData &mapData, llvm::Argument &arg,
5016  llvm::Value *input, llvm::Value *&retVal,
5017  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5018  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder,
5019  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
5020  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPoint allocaIP,
5021  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPoint codeGenIP) {
5022  assert(ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
5023  "function only supported for target device codegen");
5024  builder.restoreIP(allocaIP);
5025 
5026  omp::VariableCaptureKind capture = omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByRef;
5027  LLVM::TypeToLLVMIRTranslator typeToLLVMIRTranslator(
5028  ompBuilder.M.getContext());
5029  unsigned alignmentValue = 0;
5030  // Find the associated MapInfoData entry for the current input
5031  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i)
5032  if (mapData.OriginalValue[i] == input) {
5033  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[i]);
5034  capture = mapOp.getMapCaptureType();
5035  // Get information of alignment of mapped object
5036  alignmentValue = typeToLLVMIRTranslator.getPreferredAlignment(
5037  mapOp.getVarType(), ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout());
5038  break;
5039  }
5040 
5041  unsigned int allocaAS = ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout().getAllocaAddrSpace();
5042  unsigned int defaultAS =
5043  ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout().getProgramAddressSpace();
5044 
5045  // Create the alloca for the argument the current point.
5046  llvm::Value *v = builder.CreateAlloca(arg.getType(), allocaAS);
5047 
5048  if (allocaAS != defaultAS && arg.getType()->isPointerTy())
5049  v = builder.CreateAddrSpaceCast(v, builder.getPtrTy(defaultAS));
5050 
5051  builder.CreateStore(&arg, v);
5052 
5053  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
5054 
5055  switch (capture) {
5056  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByCopy: {
5057  retVal = v;
5058  break;
5059  }
5060  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByRef: {
5061  llvm::LoadInst *loadInst = builder.CreateAlignedLoad(
5062  v->getType(), v,
5063  ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout().getPrefTypeAlign(v->getType()));
5064  // CreateAlignedLoad function creates similar LLVM IR:
5065  // %res = load ptr, ptr %input, align 8
5066  // This LLVM IR does not contain information about alignment
5067  // of the loaded value. We need to add !align metadata to unblock
5068  // optimizer. The existence of the !align metadata on the instruction
5069  // tells the optimizer that the value loaded is known to be aligned to
5070  // a boundary specified by the integer value in the metadata node.
5071  // Example:
5072  // %res = load ptr, ptr %input, align 8, !align !align_md_node
5073  // ^ ^
5074  // | |
5075  // alignment of %input address |
5076  // |
5077  // alignment of %res object
5078  if (v->getType()->isPointerTy() && alignmentValue) {
5079  llvm::MDBuilder MDB(builder.getContext());
5080  loadInst->setMetadata(
5081  llvm::LLVMContext::MD_align,
5082  llvm::MDNode::get(builder.getContext(),
5083  MDB.createConstant(llvm::ConstantInt::get(
5084  llvm::Type::getInt64Ty(builder.getContext()),
5085  alignmentValue))));
5086  }
5087  retVal = loadInst;
5088 
5089  break;
5090  }
5091  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::This:
5092  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::VLAType:
5093  // TODO: Consider returning error to use standard reporting for
5094  // unimplemented features.
5095  assert(false && "Currently unsupported capture kind");
5096  break;
5097  }
5098 
5099  return builder.saveIP();
5100 }
5101 
5102 /// Follow uses of `host_eval`-defined block arguments of the given `omp.target`
5103 /// operation and populate output variables with their corresponding host value
5104 /// (i.e. operand evaluated outside of the target region), based on their uses
5105 /// inside of the target region.
5106 ///
5107 /// Loop bounds and steps are only optionally populated, if output vectors are
5108 /// provided.
5109 static void
5110 extractHostEvalClauses(omp::TargetOp targetOp, Value &numThreads,
5111  Value &numTeamsLower, Value &numTeamsUpper,
5112  Value &threadLimit,
5113  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *lowerBounds = nullptr,
5114  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *upperBounds = nullptr,
5115  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *steps = nullptr) {
5116  auto blockArgIface = llvm::cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(*targetOp);
5117  for (auto item : llvm::zip_equal(targetOp.getHostEvalVars(),
5118  blockArgIface.getHostEvalBlockArgs())) {
5119  Value hostEvalVar = std::get<0>(item), blockArg = std::get<1>(item);
5120 
5121  for (Operation *user : blockArg.getUsers()) {
5122  llvm::TypeSwitch<Operation *>(user)
5123  .Case([&](omp::TeamsOp teamsOp) {
5124  if (teamsOp.getNumTeamsLower() == blockArg)
5125  numTeamsLower = hostEvalVar;
5126  else if (teamsOp.getNumTeamsUpper() == blockArg)
5127  numTeamsUpper = hostEvalVar;
5128  else if (teamsOp.getThreadLimit() == blockArg)
5129  threadLimit = hostEvalVar;
5130  else
5131  llvm_unreachable("unsupported host_eval use");
5132  })
5133  .Case([&](omp::ParallelOp parallelOp) {
5134  if (parallelOp.getNumThreads() == blockArg)
5135  numThreads = hostEvalVar;
5136  else
5137  llvm_unreachable("unsupported host_eval use");
5138  })
5139  .Case([&](omp::LoopNestOp loopOp) {
5140  auto processBounds =
5141  [&](OperandRange opBounds,
5142  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *outBounds) -> bool {
5143  bool found = false;
5144  for (auto [i, lb] : llvm::enumerate(opBounds)) {
5145  if (lb == blockArg) {
5146  found = true;
5147  if (outBounds)
5148  (*outBounds)[i] = hostEvalVar;
5149  }
5150  }
5151  return found;
5152  };
5153  bool found =
5154  processBounds(loopOp.getLoopLowerBounds(), lowerBounds);
5155  found = processBounds(loopOp.getLoopUpperBounds(), upperBounds) ||
5156  found;
5157  found = processBounds(loopOp.getLoopSteps(), steps) || found;
5158  (void)found;
5159  assert(found && "unsupported host_eval use");
5160  })
5161  .Default([](Operation *) {
5162  llvm_unreachable("unsupported host_eval use");
5163  });
5164  }
5165  }
5166 }
5167 
5168 /// If \p op is of the given type parameter, return it casted to that type.
5169 /// Otherwise, if its immediate parent operation (or some other higher-level
5170 /// parent, if \p immediateParent is false) is of that type, return that parent
5171 /// casted to the given type.
5172 ///
5173 /// If \p op is \c null or neither it or its parent(s) are of the specified
5174 /// type, return a \c null operation.
5175 template <typename OpTy>
5176 static OpTy castOrGetParentOfType(Operation *op, bool immediateParent = false) {
5177  if (!op)
5178  return OpTy();
5179 
5180  if (OpTy casted = dyn_cast<OpTy>(op))
5181  return casted;
5182 
5183  if (immediateParent)
5184  return dyn_cast_if_present<OpTy>(op->getParentOp());
5185 
5186  return op->getParentOfType<OpTy>();
5187 }
5188 
5189 /// If the given \p value is defined by an \c llvm.mlir.constant operation and
5190 /// it is of an integer type, return its value.
5191 static std::optional<int64_t> extractConstInteger(Value value) {
5192  if (!value)
5193  return std::nullopt;
5194 
5195  if (auto constOp = value.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
5196  if (auto constAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
5197  return constAttr.getInt();
5198 
5199  return std::nullopt;
5200 }
5201 
5202 static uint64_t getTypeByteSize(mlir::Type type, const DataLayout &dl) {
5203  uint64_t sizeInBits = dl.getTypeSizeInBits(type);
5204  uint64_t sizeInBytes = sizeInBits / 8;
5205  return sizeInBytes;
5206 }
5207 
5208 template <typename OpTy>
5209 static uint64_t getReductionDataSize(OpTy &op) {
5210  if (op.getNumReductionVars() > 0) {
5211  SmallVector<omp::DeclareReductionOp> reductions;
5212  collectReductionDecls(op, reductions);
5213 
5214  llvm::SmallVector<mlir::Type> members;
5215  members.reserve(reductions.size());
5216  for (omp::DeclareReductionOp &red : reductions)
5217  members.push_back(red.getType());
5218  Operation *opp = op.getOperation();
5219  auto structType = mlir::LLVM::LLVMStructType::getLiteral(
5220  opp->getContext(), members, /*isPacked=*/false);
5221  DataLayout dl = DataLayout(opp->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
5222  return getTypeByteSize(structType, dl);
5223  }
5224  return 0;
5225 }
5226 
5227 /// Populate default `MinTeams`, `MaxTeams` and `MaxThreads` to their default
5228 /// values as stated by the corresponding clauses, if constant.
5229 ///
5230 /// These default values must be set before the creation of the outlined LLVM
5231 /// function for the target region, so that they can be used to initialize the
5232 /// corresponding global `ConfigurationEnvironmentTy` structure.
5233 static void
5234 initTargetDefaultAttrs(omp::TargetOp targetOp, Operation *capturedOp,
5235  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelDefaultAttrs &attrs,
5236  bool isTargetDevice, bool isGPU) {
5237  // TODO: Handle constant 'if' clauses.
5238 
5239  Value numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper, threadLimit;
5240  if (!isTargetDevice) {
5241  extractHostEvalClauses(targetOp, numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper,
5242  threadLimit);
5243  } else {
5244  // In the target device, values for these clauses are not passed as
5245  // host_eval, but instead evaluated prior to entry to the region. This
5246  // ensures values are mapped and available inside of the target region.
5247  if (auto teamsOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>(capturedOp)) {
5248  numTeamsLower = teamsOp.getNumTeamsLower();
5249  numTeamsUpper = teamsOp.getNumTeamsUpper();
5250  threadLimit = teamsOp.getThreadLimit();
5251  }
5252 
5253  if (auto parallelOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::ParallelOp>(capturedOp))
5254  numThreads = parallelOp.getNumThreads();
5255  }
5256 
5257  // Handle clauses impacting the number of teams.
5258 
5259  int32_t minTeamsVal = 1, maxTeamsVal = -1;
5260  if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>(capturedOp)) {
5261  // TODO: Use `hostNumTeamsLower` to initialize `minTeamsVal`. For now, match
5262  // clang and set min and max to the same value.
5263  if (numTeamsUpper) {
5264  if (auto val = extractConstInteger(numTeamsUpper))
5265  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = *val;
5266  } else {
5267  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = 0;
5268  }
5269  } else if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::ParallelOp>(capturedOp,
5270  /*immediateParent=*/true) ||
5271  castOrGetParentOfType<omp::SimdOp>(capturedOp,
5272  /*immediateParent=*/true)) {
5273  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = 1;
5274  } else {
5275  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = -1;
5276  }
5277 
5278  // Handle clauses impacting the number of threads.
5279 
5280  auto setMaxValueFromClause = [](Value clauseValue, int32_t &result) {
5281  if (!clauseValue)
5282  return;
5283 
5284  if (auto val = extractConstInteger(clauseValue))
5285  result = *val;
5286 
5287  // Found an applicable clause, so it's not undefined. Mark as unknown
5288  // because it's not constant.
5289  if (result < 0)
5290  result = 0;
5291  };
5292 
5293  // Extract 'thread_limit' clause from 'target' and 'teams' directives.
5294  int32_t targetThreadLimitVal = -1, teamsThreadLimitVal = -1;
5295  setMaxValueFromClause(targetOp.getThreadLimit(), targetThreadLimitVal);
5296  setMaxValueFromClause(threadLimit, teamsThreadLimitVal);
5297 
5298  // Extract 'max_threads' clause from 'parallel' or set to 1 if it's SIMD.
5299  int32_t maxThreadsVal = -1;
5300  if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::ParallelOp>(capturedOp))
5301  setMaxValueFromClause(numThreads, maxThreadsVal);
5302  else if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::SimdOp>(capturedOp,
5303  /*immediateParent=*/true))
5304  maxThreadsVal = 1;
5305 
5306  // For max values, < 0 means unset, == 0 means set but unknown. Select the
5307  // minimum value between 'max_threads' and 'thread_limit' clauses that were
5308  // set.
5309  int32_t combinedMaxThreadsVal = targetThreadLimitVal;
5310  if (combinedMaxThreadsVal < 0 ||
5311  (teamsThreadLimitVal >= 0 && teamsThreadLimitVal < combinedMaxThreadsVal))
5312  combinedMaxThreadsVal = teamsThreadLimitVal;
5313 
5314  if (combinedMaxThreadsVal < 0 ||
5315  (maxThreadsVal >= 0 && maxThreadsVal < combinedMaxThreadsVal))
5316  combinedMaxThreadsVal = maxThreadsVal;
5317 
5318  int32_t reductionDataSize = 0;
5319  if (isGPU && capturedOp) {
5320  if (auto teamsOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>(capturedOp))
5321  reductionDataSize = getReductionDataSize(teamsOp);
5322  }
5323 
5324  // Update kernel bounds structure for the `OpenMPIRBuilder` to use.
5325  omp::TargetRegionFlags kernelFlags = targetOp.getKernelExecFlags(capturedOp);
5326  assert(
5327  omp::bitEnumContainsAny(kernelFlags, omp::TargetRegionFlags::generic |
5328  omp::TargetRegionFlags::spmd) &&
5329  "invalid kernel flags");
5330  attrs.ExecFlags =
5331  omp::bitEnumContainsAny(kernelFlags, omp::TargetRegionFlags::generic)
5332  ? omp::bitEnumContainsAny(kernelFlags, omp::TargetRegionFlags::spmd)
5333  ? llvm::omp::OMP_TGT_EXEC_MODE_GENERIC_SPMD
5334  : llvm::omp::OMP_TGT_EXEC_MODE_GENERIC
5335  : llvm::omp::OMP_TGT_EXEC_MODE_SPMD;
5336  attrs.MinTeams = minTeamsVal;
5337  attrs.MaxTeams.front() = maxTeamsVal;
5338  attrs.MinThreads = 1;
5339  attrs.MaxThreads.front() = combinedMaxThreadsVal;
5340  attrs.ReductionDataSize = reductionDataSize;
5341  // TODO: Allow modified buffer length similar to
5342  // fopenmp-cuda-teams-reduction-recs-num flag in clang.
5343  if (attrs.ReductionDataSize != 0)
5344  attrs.ReductionBufferLength = 1024;
5345 }
5346 
5347 /// Gather LLVM runtime values for all clauses evaluated in the host that are
5348 /// passed to the kernel invocation.
5349 ///
5350 /// This function must be called only when compiling for the host. Also, it will
5351 /// only provide correct results if it's called after the body of \c targetOp
5352 /// has been fully generated.
5353 static void
5354 initTargetRuntimeAttrs(llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5355  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
5356  omp::TargetOp targetOp, Operation *capturedOp,
5357  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelRuntimeAttrs &attrs) {
5358  omp::LoopNestOp loopOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::LoopNestOp>(capturedOp);
5359  unsigned numLoops = loopOp ? loopOp.getNumLoops() : 0;
5360 
5361  Value numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper, teamsThreadLimit;
5362  llvm::SmallVector<Value> lowerBounds(numLoops), upperBounds(numLoops),
5363  steps(numLoops);
5364  extractHostEvalClauses(targetOp, numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper,
5365  teamsThreadLimit, &lowerBounds, &upperBounds, &steps);
5366 
5367  // TODO: Handle constant 'if' clauses.
5368  if (Value targetThreadLimit = targetOp.getThreadLimit())
5369  attrs.TargetThreadLimit.front() =
5370  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(targetThreadLimit);
5371 
5372  if (numTeamsLower)
5373  attrs.MinTeams = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(numTeamsLower);
5374 
5375  if (numTeamsUpper)
5376  attrs.MaxTeams.front() = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(numTeamsUpper);
5377 
5378  if (teamsThreadLimit)
5379  attrs.TeamsThreadLimit.front() =
5380  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(teamsThreadLimit);
5381 
5382  if (numThreads)
5383  attrs.MaxThreads = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(numThreads);
5384 
5385  if (omp::bitEnumContainsAny(targetOp.getKernelExecFlags(capturedOp),
5386  omp::TargetRegionFlags::trip_count)) {
5387  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
5388  attrs.LoopTripCount = nullptr;
5389 
5390  // To calculate the trip count, we multiply together the trip counts of
5391  // every collapsed canonical loop. We don't need to create the loop nests
5392  // here, since we're only interested in the trip count.
5393  for (auto [loopLower, loopUpper, loopStep] :
5394  llvm::zip_equal(lowerBounds, upperBounds, steps)) {
5395  llvm::Value *lowerBound = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(loopLower);
5396  llvm::Value *upperBound = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(loopUpper);
5397  llvm::Value *step = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(loopStep);
5398 
5399  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription loc(builder);
5400  llvm::Value *tripCount = ompBuilder->calculateCanonicalLoopTripCount(
5401  loc, lowerBound, upperBound, step, /*IsSigned=*/true,
5402  loopOp.getLoopInclusive());
5403 
5404  if (!attrs.LoopTripCount) {
5405  attrs.LoopTripCount = tripCount;
5406  continue;
5407  }
5408 
5409  // TODO: Enable UndefinedSanitizer to diagnose an overflow here.
5410  attrs.LoopTripCount = builder.CreateMul(attrs.LoopTripCount, tripCount,
5411  {}, /*HasNUW=*/true);
5412  }
5413  }
5414 }
5415 
5416 static LogicalResult
5417 convertOmpTarget(Operation &opInst, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5418  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
5419  auto targetOp = cast<omp::TargetOp>(opInst);
5420  // The current debug location already has the DISubprogram for the outlined
5421  // function that will be created for the target op. We save it here so that
5422  // we can set it on the outlined function.
5423  llvm::DebugLoc outlinedFnLoc = builder.getCurrentDebugLocation();
5424  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(opInst)))
5425  return failure();
5426 
5427  // During the handling of target op, we will generate instructions in the
5428  // parent function like call to the oulined function or branch to a new
5429  // BasicBlock. We set the debug location here to parent function so that those
5430  // get the correct debug locations. For outlined functions, the normal MLIR op
5431  // conversion will automatically pick the correct location.
5432  llvm::BasicBlock *parentBB = builder.GetInsertBlock();
5433  assert(parentBB && "No insert block is set for the builder");
5434  llvm::Function *parentLLVMFn = parentBB->getParent();
5435  assert(parentLLVMFn && "Parent Function must be valid");
5436  if (llvm::DISubprogram *SP = parentLLVMFn->getSubprogram())
5437  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(llvm::DILocation::get(
5438  parentLLVMFn->getContext(), outlinedFnLoc.getLine(),
5439  outlinedFnLoc.getCol(), SP, outlinedFnLoc.getInlinedAt()));
5440 
5441  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
5442  bool isTargetDevice = ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice();
5443  bool isGPU = ompBuilder->Config.isGPU();
5444 
5445  auto parentFn = opInst.getParentOfType<LLVM::LLVMFuncOp>();
5446  auto argIface = cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(opInst);
5447  auto &targetRegion = targetOp.getRegion();
5448  // Holds the private vars that have been mapped along with the block argument
5449  // that corresponds to the MapInfoOp corresponding to the private var in
5450  // question. So, for instance:
5451  //
5452  // %10 = omp.map.info var_ptr(%6#0 : !fir.ref<!fir.box<!fir.heap<i32>>>, ..)
5453  // omp.target map_entries(%10 -> %arg0) private(@box.privatizer %6#0-> %arg1)
5454  //
5455  // Then, %10 has been created so that the descriptor can be used by the
5456  // privatizer @box.privatizer on the device side. Here we'd record {%6#0,
5457  // %arg0} in the mappedPrivateVars map.
5458  llvm::DenseMap<Value, Value> mappedPrivateVars;
5459  DataLayout dl = DataLayout(opInst.getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
5460  SmallVector<Value> mapVars = targetOp.getMapVars();
5461  SmallVector<Value> hdaVars = targetOp.getHasDeviceAddrVars();
5462  ArrayRef<BlockArgument> mapBlockArgs = argIface.getMapBlockArgs();
5463  ArrayRef<BlockArgument> hdaBlockArgs = argIface.getHasDeviceAddrBlockArgs();
5464  llvm::Function *llvmOutlinedFn = nullptr;
5465 
5466  // TODO: It can also be false if a compile-time constant `false` IF clause is
5467  // specified.
5468  bool isOffloadEntry =
5469  isTargetDevice || !ompBuilder->Config.TargetTriples.empty();
5470 
5471  // For some private variables, the MapsForPrivatizedVariablesPass
5472  // creates MapInfoOp instances. Go through the private variables and
5473  // the mapped variables so that during codegeneration we are able
5474  // to quickly look up the corresponding map variable, if any for each
5475  // private variable.
5476  if (!targetOp.getPrivateVars().empty() && !targetOp.getMapVars().empty()) {
5477  OperandRange privateVars = targetOp.getPrivateVars();
5478  std::optional<ArrayAttr> privateSyms = targetOp.getPrivateSyms();
5479  std::optional<DenseI64ArrayAttr> privateMapIndices =
5480  targetOp.getPrivateMapsAttr();
5481 
5482  for (auto [privVarIdx, privVarSymPair] :
5483  llvm::enumerate(llvm::zip_equal(privateVars, *privateSyms))) {
5484  auto privVar = std::get<0>(privVarSymPair);
5485  auto privSym = std::get<1>(privVarSymPair);
5486 
5487  SymbolRefAttr privatizerName = llvm::cast<SymbolRefAttr>(privSym);
5488  omp::PrivateClauseOp privatizer =
5489  findPrivatizer(targetOp, privatizerName);
5490 
5491  if (!privatizer.needsMap())
5492  continue;
5493 
5494  mlir::Value mappedValue =
5495  targetOp.getMappedValueForPrivateVar(privVarIdx);
5496  assert(mappedValue && "Expected to find mapped value for a privatized "
5497  "variable that needs mapping");
5498 
5499  // The MapInfoOp defining the map var isn't really needed later.
5500  // So, we don't store it in any datastructure. Instead, we just
5501  // do some sanity checks on it right now.
5502  auto mapInfoOp = mappedValue.getDefiningOp<omp::MapInfoOp>();
5503  [[maybe_unused]] Type varType = mapInfoOp.getVarType();
5504 
5505  // Check #1: Check that the type of the private variable matches
5506  // the type of the variable being mapped.
5507  if (!isa<LLVM::LLVMPointerType>(privVar.getType()))
5508  assert(
5509  varType == privVar.getType() &&
5510  "Type of private var doesn't match the type of the mapped value");
5511 
5512  // Ok, only 1 sanity check for now.
5513  // Record the block argument corresponding to this mapvar.
5514  mappedPrivateVars.insert(
5515  {privVar,
5516  targetRegion.getArgument(argIface.getMapBlockArgsStart() +
5517  (*privateMapIndices)[privVarIdx])});
5518  }
5519  }
5520 
5521  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
5522  auto bodyCB = [&](InsertPointTy allocaIP, InsertPointTy codeGenIP)
5523  -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy {
5524  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPointGuard guard(builder);
5525  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(llvm::DebugLoc());
5526  // Forward target-cpu and target-features function attributes from the
5527  // original function to the new outlined function.
5528  llvm::Function *llvmParentFn =
5529  moduleTranslation.lookupFunction(parentFn.getName());
5530  llvmOutlinedFn = codeGenIP.getBlock()->getParent();
5531  assert(llvmParentFn && llvmOutlinedFn &&
5532  "Both parent and outlined functions must exist at this point");
5533 
5534  if (outlinedFnLoc && llvmParentFn->getSubprogram())
5535  llvmOutlinedFn->setSubprogram(outlinedFnLoc->getScope()->getSubprogram());
5536 
5537  if (auto attr = llvmParentFn->getFnAttribute("target-cpu");
5538  attr.isStringAttribute())
5539  llvmOutlinedFn->addFnAttr(attr);
5540 
5541  if (auto attr = llvmParentFn->getFnAttribute("target-features");
5542  attr.isStringAttribute())
5543  llvmOutlinedFn->addFnAttr(attr);
5544 
5545  for (auto [arg, mapOp] : llvm::zip_equal(mapBlockArgs, mapVars)) {
5546  auto mapInfoOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapOp.getDefiningOp());
5547  llvm::Value *mapOpValue =
5548  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(mapInfoOp.getVarPtr());
5549  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, mapOpValue);
5550  }
5551  for (auto [arg, mapOp] : llvm::zip_equal(hdaBlockArgs, hdaVars)) {
5552  auto mapInfoOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapOp.getDefiningOp());
5553  llvm::Value *mapOpValue =
5554  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(mapInfoOp.getVarPtr());
5555  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, mapOpValue);
5556  }
5557 
5558  // Do privatization after moduleTranslation has already recorded
5559  // mapped values.
5560  PrivateVarsInfo privateVarsInfo(targetOp);
5561 
5562  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> afterAllocas =
