5563  allocatePrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privateVarsInfo,
5564  allocaIP, &mappedPrivateVars);
5565 
5566  if (failed(handleError(afterAllocas, *targetOp)))
5567  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
5568 
5569  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
5570  if (handleError(initPrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privateVarsInfo,
5571  &mappedPrivateVars),
5572  *targetOp)
5573  .failed())
5574  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
5575 
5576  if (failed(copyFirstPrivateVars(
5577  targetOp, builder, moduleTranslation, privateVarsInfo.mlirVars,
5578  privateVarsInfo.llvmVars, privateVarsInfo.privatizers,
5579  targetOp.getPrivateNeedsBarrier(), &mappedPrivateVars)))
5580  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
5581 
5582  SmallVector<Region *> privateCleanupRegions;
5583  llvm::transform(privateVarsInfo.privatizers,
5584  std::back_inserter(privateCleanupRegions),
5585  [](omp::PrivateClauseOp privatizer) {
5586  return &privatizer.getDeallocRegion();
5587  });
5588 
5589  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> exitBlock = convertOmpOpRegions(
5590  targetRegion, "omp.target", builder, moduleTranslation);
5591 
5592  if (!exitBlock)
5593  return exitBlock.takeError();
5594 
5595  builder.SetInsertPoint(*exitBlock);
5596  if (!privateCleanupRegions.empty()) {
5597  if (failed(inlineOmpRegionCleanup(
5598  privateCleanupRegions, privateVarsInfo.llvmVars,
5599  moduleTranslation, builder, "omp.targetop.private.cleanup",
5600  /*shouldLoadCleanupRegionArg=*/false))) {
5601  return llvm::createStringError(
5602  "failed to inline `dealloc` region of `omp.private` "
5603  "op in the target region");
5604  }
5605  return builder.saveIP();
5606  }
5607 
5608  return InsertPointTy(exitBlock.get(), exitBlock.get()->end());
5609  };
5610 
5611  StringRef parentName = parentFn.getName();
5612 
5613  llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo entryInfo;
5614 
5615  getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(entryInfo, targetOp, parentName);
5616 
5617  MapInfoData mapData;
5618  collectMapDataFromMapOperands(mapData, mapVars, moduleTranslation, dl,
5619  builder, /*useDevPtrOperands=*/{},
5620  /*useDevAddrOperands=*/{}, hdaVars);
5621 
5622  MapInfosTy combinedInfos;
5623  auto genMapInfoCB =
5624  [&](llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy codeGenIP) -> MapInfosTy & {
5625  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
5626  genMapInfos(builder, moduleTranslation, dl, combinedInfos, mapData, true);
5627  return combinedInfos;
5628  };
5629 
5630  auto argAccessorCB = [&](llvm::Argument &arg, llvm::Value *input,
5631  llvm::Value *&retVal, InsertPointTy allocaIP,
5632  InsertPointTy codeGenIP)
5633  -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy {
5634  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPointGuard guard(builder);
5635  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(llvm::DebugLoc());
5636  // We just return the unaltered argument for the host function
5637  // for now, some alterations may be required in the future to
5638  // keep host fallback functions working identically to the device
5639  // version (e.g. pass ByCopy values should be treated as such on
5640  // host and device, currently not always the case)
5641  if (!isTargetDevice) {
5642  retVal = cast<llvm::Value>(&arg);
5643  return codeGenIP;
5644  }
5645 
5646  return createDeviceArgumentAccessor(mapData, arg, input, retVal, builder,
5647  *ompBuilder, moduleTranslation,
5648  allocaIP, codeGenIP);
5649  };
5650 
5651  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelRuntimeAttrs runtimeAttrs;
5652  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelDefaultAttrs defaultAttrs;
5653  Operation *targetCapturedOp = targetOp.getInnermostCapturedOmpOp();
5654  initTargetDefaultAttrs(targetOp, targetCapturedOp, defaultAttrs,
5655  isTargetDevice, isGPU);
5656 
5657  // Collect host-evaluated values needed to properly launch the kernel from the
5658  // host.
5659  if (!isTargetDevice)
5660  initTargetRuntimeAttrs(builder, moduleTranslation, targetOp,
5661  targetCapturedOp, runtimeAttrs);
5662 
5663  // Pass host-evaluated values as parameters to the kernel / host fallback,
5664  // except if they are constants. In any case, map the MLIR block argument to
5665  // the corresponding LLVM values.
5666  llvm::SmallVector<llvm::Value *, 4> kernelInput;
5667  SmallVector<Value> hostEvalVars = targetOp.getHostEvalVars();
5668  ArrayRef<BlockArgument> hostEvalBlockArgs = argIface.getHostEvalBlockArgs();
5669  for (auto [arg, var] : llvm::zip_equal(hostEvalBlockArgs, hostEvalVars)) {
5670  llvm::Value *value = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(var);
5671  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, value);
5672 
5673  if (!llvm::isa<llvm::Constant>(value))
5674  kernelInput.push_back(value);
5675  }
5676 
5677  for (size_t i = 0, e = mapData.OriginalValue.size(); i != e; ++i) {
5678  // declare target arguments are not passed to kernels as arguments
5679  // TODO: We currently do not handle cases where a member is explicitly
5680  // passed in as an argument, this will likley need to be handled in
5681  // the near future, rather than using IsAMember, it may be better to
5682  // test if the relevant BlockArg is used within the target region and
5683  // then use that as a basis for exclusion in the kernel inputs.
5684  if (!mapData.IsDeclareTarget[i] && !mapData.IsAMember[i])
5685  kernelInput.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue[i]);
5686  }
5687 
5688  SmallVector<llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DependData> dds;
5689  buildDependData(targetOp.getDependKinds(), targetOp.getDependVars(),
5690  moduleTranslation, dds);
5691 
5692  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
5693  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
5694  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
5695 
5696  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetDataInfo info(
5697  /*RequiresDevicePointerInfo=*/false,
5698  /*SeparateBeginEndCalls=*/true);
5699 
5700  auto customMapperCB =
5701  [&](unsigned int i) -> llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> {
5702  if (!combinedInfos.Mappers[i])
5703  return nullptr;
5704  info.HasMapper = true;
5705  return getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(combinedInfos.Mappers[i], builder,
5706  moduleTranslation);
5707  };
5708 
5709  llvm::Value *ifCond = nullptr;
5710  if (Value targetIfCond = targetOp.getIfExpr())
5711  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(targetIfCond);
5712 
5713  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP =
5714  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->createTarget(
5715  ompLoc, isOffloadEntry, allocaIP, builder.saveIP(), info, entryInfo,
5716  defaultAttrs, runtimeAttrs, ifCond, kernelInput, genMapInfoCB, bodyCB,
5717  argAccessorCB, customMapperCB, dds, targetOp.getNowait());
5718 
5719  if (failed(handleError(afterIP, opInst)))
5720  return failure();
5721 
5722  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
5723 
5724  // Remap access operations to declare target reference pointers for the
5725  // device, essentially generating extra loadop's as necessary
5726  if (moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice())
5727  handleDeclareTargetMapVar(mapData, moduleTranslation, builder,
5728  llvmOutlinedFn);
5729 
5730  return success();
5731 }
5732 
5733 static LogicalResult
5734 convertDeclareTargetAttr(Operation *op, mlir::omp::DeclareTargetAttr attribute,
5735  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
5736  // Amend omp.declare_target by deleting the IR of the outlined functions
5737  // created for target regions. They cannot be filtered out from MLIR earlier
5738  // because the omp.target operation inside must be translated to LLVM, but
5739  // the wrapper functions themselves must not remain at the end of the
5740  // process. We know that functions where omp.declare_target does not match
5741  // omp.is_target_device at this stage can only be wrapper functions because
5742  // those that aren't are removed earlier as an MLIR transformation pass.
5743  if (FunctionOpInterface funcOp = dyn_cast<FunctionOpInterface>(op)) {
5744  if (auto offloadMod = dyn_cast<omp::OffloadModuleInterface>(
5745  op->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>().getOperation())) {
5746  if (!offloadMod.getIsTargetDevice())
5747  return success();
5748 
5749  omp::DeclareTargetDeviceType declareType =
5750  attribute.getDeviceType().getValue();
5751 
5752  if (declareType == omp::DeclareTargetDeviceType::host) {
5753  llvm::Function *llvmFunc =
5754  moduleTranslation.lookupFunction(funcOp.getName());
5755  llvmFunc->dropAllReferences();
5756  llvmFunc->eraseFromParent();
5757  }
5758  }
5759  return success();
5760  }
5761 
5762  if (LLVM::GlobalOp gOp = dyn_cast<LLVM::GlobalOp>(op)) {
5763  llvm::Module *llvmModule = moduleTranslation.getLLVMModule();
5764  if (auto *gVal = llvmModule->getNamedValue(gOp.getSymName())) {
5765  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
5766  bool isDeclaration = gOp.isDeclaration();
5767  bool isExternallyVisible =
5768  gOp.getVisibility() != mlir::SymbolTable::Visibility::Private;
5769  auto loc = op->getLoc()->findInstanceOf<FileLineColLoc>();
5770  llvm::StringRef mangledName = gOp.getSymName();
5771  auto captureClause =
5772  convertToCaptureClauseKind(attribute.getCaptureClause().getValue());
5773  auto deviceClause =
5774  convertToDeviceClauseKind(attribute.getDeviceType().getValue());
5775  // unused for MLIR at the moment, required in Clang for book
5776  // keeping
5777  std::vector<llvm::GlobalVariable *> generatedRefs;
5778 
5779  std::vector<llvm::Triple> targetTriple;
5780  auto targetTripleAttr = dyn_cast_or_null<mlir::StringAttr>(
5781  op->getParentOfType<mlir::ModuleOp>()->getAttr(
5782  LLVM::LLVMDialect::getTargetTripleAttrName()));
5783  if (targetTripleAttr)
5784  targetTriple.emplace_back(targetTripleAttr.data());
5785 
5786  auto fileInfoCallBack = [&loc]() {
5787  std::string filename = "";
5788  std::uint64_t lineNo = 0;
5789 
5790  if (loc) {
5791  filename = loc.getFilename().str();
5792  lineNo = loc.getLine();
5793  }
5794 
5795  return std::pair<std::string, std::uint64_t>(llvm::StringRef(filename),
5796  lineNo);
5797  };
5798 
5799  ompBuilder->registerTargetGlobalVariable(
5800  captureClause, deviceClause, isDeclaration, isExternallyVisible,
5801  ompBuilder->getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(fileInfoCallBack), mangledName,
5802  generatedRefs, /*OpenMPSimd*/ false, targetTriple,
5803  /*GlobalInitializer*/ nullptr, /*VariableLinkage*/ nullptr,
5804  gVal->getType(), gVal);
5805 
5806  if (ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
5807  (attribute.getCaptureClause().getValue() !=
5808  mlir::omp::DeclareTargetCaptureClause::to ||
5809  ompBuilder->Config.hasRequiresUnifiedSharedMemory())) {
5810  ompBuilder->getAddrOfDeclareTargetVar(
5811  captureClause, deviceClause, isDeclaration, isExternallyVisible,
5812  ompBuilder->getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(fileInfoCallBack), mangledName,
5813  generatedRefs, /*OpenMPSimd*/ false, targetTriple, gVal->getType(),
5814  /*GlobalInitializer*/ nullptr,
5815  /*VariableLinkage*/ nullptr);
5816  }
5817  }
5818  }
5819 
5820  return success();
5821 }
5822 
5823 // Returns true if the operation is inside a TargetOp or
5824 // is part of a declare target function.
5825 static bool isTargetDeviceOp(Operation *op) {
5826  // Assumes no reverse offloading
5827  if (op->getParentOfType<omp::TargetOp>())
5828  return true;
5829 
5830  // Certain operations return results, and whether utilised in host or
5831  // target there is a chance an LLVM Dialect operation depends on it
5832  // by taking it in as an operand, so we must always lower these in
5833  // some manner or result in an ICE (whether they end up in a no-op
5834  // or otherwise).
5835  if (mlir::isa<omp::ThreadprivateOp>(op))
5836  return true;
5837 
5838  if (auto parentFn = op->getParentOfType<LLVM::LLVMFuncOp>())
5839  if (auto declareTargetIface =
5840  llvm::dyn_cast<mlir::omp::DeclareTargetInterface>(
5841  parentFn.getOperation()))
5842  if (declareTargetIface.isDeclareTarget() &&
5843  declareTargetIface.getDeclareTargetDeviceType() !=
5844  mlir::omp::DeclareTargetDeviceType::host)
5845  return true;
5846 
5847  return false;
5848 }
5849 
5850 /// Given an OpenMP MLIR operation, create the corresponding LLVM IR (including
5851 /// OpenMP runtime calls).
5852 static LogicalResult
5853 convertHostOrTargetOperation(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5854  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
5855  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
5856 
5857  // For each loop, introduce one stack frame to hold loop information. Ensure
5858  // this is only done for the outermost loop wrapper to prevent introducing
5859  // multiple stack frames for a single loop. Initially set to null, the loop
5860  // information structure is initialized during translation of the nested
5861  // omp.loop_nest operation, making it available to translation of all loop
5862  // wrappers after their body has been successfully translated.
5863  bool isOutermostLoopWrapper =
5864  isa_and_present<omp::LoopWrapperInterface>(op) &&
5865  !dyn_cast_if_present<omp::LoopWrapperInterface>(op->getParentOp());
5866 
5867  if (isOutermostLoopWrapper)
5868  moduleTranslation.stackPush<OpenMPLoopInfoStackFrame>();
5869 
5870  auto result =
5871  llvm::TypeSwitch<Operation *, LogicalResult>(op)
5872  .Case([&](omp::BarrierOp op) -> LogicalResult {
5873  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*op)))
5874  return failure();
5875 
5876  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP =
5877  ompBuilder->createBarrier(builder.saveIP(),
5878  llvm::omp::OMPD_barrier);
5879  LogicalResult res = handleError(afterIP, *op);
5880  if (res.succeeded()) {
5881  // If the barrier generated a cancellation check, the insertion
5882  // point might now need to be changed to a new continuation block
5883  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
5884  }
5885  return res;
5886  })
5887  .Case([&](omp::TaskyieldOp op) {
5888  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*op)))
5889  return failure();
5890 
5891  ompBuilder->createTaskyield(builder.saveIP());
5892  return success();
5893  })
5894  .Case([&](omp::FlushOp op) {
5895  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*op)))
5896  return failure();
5897 
5898  // No support in Openmp runtime function (__kmpc_flush) to accept
5899  // the argument list.
5900  // OpenMP standard states the following:
5901  // "An implementation may implement a flush with a list by ignoring
5902  // the list, and treating it the same as a flush without a list."
5903  //
5904  // The argument list is discarded so that, flush with a list is
5905  // treated same as a flush without a list.
5906  ompBuilder->createFlush(builder.saveIP());
5907  return success();
5908  })
5909  .Case([&](omp::ParallelOp op) {
5910  return convertOmpParallel(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5911  })
5912  .Case([&](omp::MaskedOp) {
5913  return convertOmpMasked(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5914  })
5915  .Case([&](omp::MasterOp) {
5916  return convertOmpMaster(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5917  })
5918  .Case([&](omp::CriticalOp) {
5919  return convertOmpCritical(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5920  })
5921  .Case([&](omp::OrderedRegionOp) {
5922  return convertOmpOrderedRegion(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5923  })
5924  .Case([&](omp::OrderedOp) {
5925  return convertOmpOrdered(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5926  })
5927  .Case([&](omp::WsloopOp) {
5928  return convertOmpWsloop(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5929  })
5930  .Case([&](omp::SimdOp) {
5931  return convertOmpSimd(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5932  })
5933  .Case([&](omp::AtomicReadOp) {
5934  return convertOmpAtomicRead(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5935  })
5936  .Case([&](omp::AtomicWriteOp) {
5937  return convertOmpAtomicWrite(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5938  })
5939  .Case([&](omp::AtomicUpdateOp op) {
5940  return convertOmpAtomicUpdate(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5941  })
5942  .Case([&](omp::AtomicCaptureOp op) {
5943  return convertOmpAtomicCapture(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5944  })
5945  .Case([&](omp::CancelOp op) {
5946  return convertOmpCancel(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5947  })
5948  .Case([&](omp::CancellationPointOp op) {
5949  return convertOmpCancellationPoint(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5950  })
5951  .Case([&](omp::SectionsOp) {
5952  return convertOmpSections(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5953  })
5954  .Case([&](omp::SingleOp op) {
5955  return convertOmpSingle(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5956  })
5957  .Case([&](omp::TeamsOp op) {
5958  return convertOmpTeams(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5959  })
5960  .Case([&](omp::TaskOp op) {
5961  return convertOmpTaskOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5962  })
5963  .Case([&](omp::TaskgroupOp op) {
5964  return convertOmpTaskgroupOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5965  })
5966  .Case([&](omp::TaskwaitOp op) {
5967  return convertOmpTaskwaitOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5968  })
5969  .Case<omp::YieldOp, omp::TerminatorOp, omp::DeclareMapperOp,
5970  omp::DeclareMapperInfoOp, omp::DeclareReductionOp,
5971  omp::CriticalDeclareOp>([](auto op) {
5972  // `yield` and `terminator` can be just omitted. The block structure
5973  // was created in the region that handles their parent operation.
5974  // `declare_reduction` will be used by reductions and is not
5975  // converted directly, skip it.
5976  // `declare_mapper` and `declare_mapper.info` are handled whenever
5977  // they are referred to through a `map` clause.
5978  // `critical.declare` is only used to declare names of critical
5979  // sections which will be used by `critical` ops and hence can be
5980  // ignored for lowering. The OpenMP IRBuilder will create unique
5981  // name for critical section names.
5982  return success();
5983  })
5984  .Case([&](omp::ThreadprivateOp) {
5985  return convertOmpThreadprivate(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5986  })
5987  .Case<omp::TargetDataOp, omp::TargetEnterDataOp,
5988  omp::TargetExitDataOp, omp::TargetUpdateOp>([&](auto op) {
5989  return convertOmpTargetData(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5990  })
5991  .Case([&](omp::TargetOp) {
5992  return convertOmpTarget(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5993  })
5994  .Case([&](omp::DistributeOp) {
5995  return convertOmpDistribute(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5996  })
5997  .Case([&](omp::LoopNestOp) {
5998  return convertOmpLoopNest(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
5999  })
6000  .Case<omp::MapInfoOp, omp::MapBoundsOp, omp::PrivateClauseOp>(
6001  [&](auto op) {
6002  // No-op, should be handled by relevant owning operations e.g.
6003  // TargetOp, TargetEnterDataOp, TargetExitDataOp, TargetDataOp
6004  // etc. and then discarded
6005  return success();
6006  })
6007  .Case([&](omp::NewCliOp op) {
6008  // Meta-operation: Doesn't do anything by itself, but used to
6009  // identify a loop.
6010  return success();
6011  })
6012  .Case([&](omp::CanonicalLoopOp op) {
6013  return convertOmpCanonicalLoopOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6014  })
6015  .Case([&](omp::UnrollHeuristicOp op) {
6016  // FIXME: Handling omp.unroll_heuristic as an executable requires
6017  // that the generator (e.g. omp.canonical_loop) has been seen first.
6018  // For construct that require all codegen to occur inside a callback
6019  // (e.g. OpenMPIRBilder::createParallel), all codegen of that
6020  // contained region including their transformations must occur at
6021  // the omp.canonical_loop.
6022  return applyUnrollHeuristic(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6023  })
6024  .Default([&](Operation *inst) {
6025  return inst->emitError()
6026  << "not yet implemented: " << inst->getName();
6027  });
6028 
6029  if (isOutermostLoopWrapper)
6030  moduleTranslation.stackPop();
6031 
6032  return result;
6033 }
6034 
6035 static LogicalResult
6036 convertTargetDeviceOp(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6037  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
6038  return convertHostOrTargetOperation(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6039 }
6040 
6041 static LogicalResult
6042 convertTargetOpsInNest(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6043  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
6044  if (isa<omp::TargetOp>(op))
6045  return convertOmpTarget(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6046  if (isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(op))
6047  return convertOmpTargetData(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6048  bool interrupted =
6049  op->walk<WalkOrder::PreOrder>([&](Operation *oper) {
6050  if (isa<omp::TargetOp>(oper)) {
6051  if (failed(convertOmpTarget(*oper, builder, moduleTranslation)))
6052  return WalkResult::interrupt();
6053  return WalkResult::skip();
6054  }
6055  if (isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(oper)) {
6056  if (failed(convertOmpTargetData(oper, builder, moduleTranslation)))
6057  return WalkResult::interrupt();
6058  return WalkResult::skip();
6059  }
6060 
6061  // Non-target ops might nest target-related ops, therefore, we
6062  // translate them as non-OpenMP scopes. Translating them is needed by
6063  // nested target-related ops since they might need LLVM values defined
6064  // in their parent non-target ops.
6065  if (isa<omp::OpenMPDialect>(oper->getDialect()) &&
6066  oper->getParentOfType<LLVM::LLVMFuncOp>() &&
6067  !oper->getRegions().empty()) {
6068  if (auto blockArgsIface =
6069  dyn_cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(oper))
6070  forwardArgs(moduleTranslation, blockArgsIface);
6071  else {
6072  // Here we map entry block arguments of
6073  // non-BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface ops if they can be encountered
6074  // inside of a function and they define any of these arguments.
6075  if (isa<mlir::omp::AtomicUpdateOp>(oper))
6076  for (auto [operand, arg] :
6077  llvm::zip_equal(oper->getOperands(),
6078  oper->getRegion(0).getArguments())) {
6079  moduleTranslation.mapValue(
6080  arg, builder.CreateLoad(
6081  moduleTranslation.convertType(arg.getType()),
6082  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(operand)));
6083  }
6084  }
6085 
6086  if (auto loopNest = dyn_cast<omp::LoopNestOp>(oper)) {
6087  assert(builder.GetInsertBlock() &&
6088  "No insert block is set for the builder");
6089  for (auto iv : loopNest.getIVs()) {
6090  // Map iv to an undefined value just to keep the IR validity.
6091  moduleTranslation.mapValue(
6092  iv, llvm::PoisonValue::get(
6093  moduleTranslation.convertType(iv.getType())));
6094  }
6095  }
6096 
6097  for (Region &region : oper->getRegions()) {
6098  // Regions are fake in the sense that they are not a truthful
6099  // translation of the OpenMP construct being converted (e.g. no
6100  // OpenMP runtime calls will be generated). We just need this to
6101  // prepare the kernel invocation args.
6102  SmallVector<llvm::PHINode *> phis;
6103  auto result = convertOmpOpRegions(
6104  region, oper->getName().getStringRef().str() + ".fake.region",
6105  builder, moduleTranslation, &phis);
6106  if (failed(handleError(result, *oper)))
6107  return WalkResult::interrupt();
6108 
6109  builder.SetInsertPoint(result.get(), result.get()->end());
6110  }
6111 
6112  return WalkResult::skip();
6113  }
6114 
6115  return WalkResult::advance();
6116  }).wasInterrupted();
6117  return failure(interrupted);
6118 }
6119 
6120 namespace {
6121 
6122 /// Implementation of the dialect interface that converts operations belonging
6123 /// to the OpenMP dialect to LLVM IR.
6124 class OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface
6125  : public LLVMTranslationDialectInterface {
6126 public:
6127  using LLVMTranslationDialectInterface::LLVMTranslationDialectInterface;
6128 
6129  /// Translates the given operation to LLVM IR using the provided IR builder
6130  /// and saving the state in `moduleTranslation`.
6131  LogicalResult
6132  convertOperation(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6133  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const final;
6134 
6135  /// Given an OpenMP MLIR attribute, create the corresponding LLVM-IR,
6136  /// runtime calls, or operation amendments
6137  LogicalResult
6138  amendOperation(Operation *op, ArrayRef<llvm::Instruction *> instructions,
6139  NamedAttribute attribute,
6140  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const final;
6141 };
6142 
6143 } // namespace
6144 
6145 LogicalResult OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface::amendOperation(
6146  Operation *op, ArrayRef<llvm::Instruction *> instructions,
6147  NamedAttribute attribute,
6148  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const {
6149  return llvm::StringSwitch<llvm::function_ref<LogicalResult(Attribute)>>(
6150  attribute.getName())
6151  .Case("omp.is_target_device",
6152  [&](Attribute attr) {
6153  if (auto deviceAttr = dyn_cast<BoolAttr>(attr)) {
6154  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6155  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6156  config.setIsTargetDevice(deviceAttr.getValue());
6157  return success();
6158  }
6159  return failure();
6160  })
6161  .Case("omp.is_gpu",
6162  [&](Attribute attr) {
6163  if (auto gpuAttr = dyn_cast<BoolAttr>(attr)) {
6164  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6165  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6166  config.setIsGPU(gpuAttr.getValue());
6167  return success();
6168  }
6169  return failure();
6170  })
6171  .Case("omp.host_ir_filepath",
6172  [&](Attribute attr) {
6173  if (auto filepathAttr = dyn_cast<StringAttr>(attr)) {
6174  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder =
6175  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
6176  ompBuilder->loadOffloadInfoMetadata(filepathAttr.getValue());
6177  return success();
6178  }
6179  return failure();
6180  })
6181  .Case("omp.flags",
6182  [&](Attribute attr) {
6183  if (auto rtlAttr = dyn_cast<omp::FlagsAttr>(attr))
6184  return convertFlagsAttr(op, rtlAttr, moduleTranslation);
6185  return failure();
6186  })
6187  .Case("omp.version",
6188  [&](Attribute attr) {
6189  if (auto versionAttr = dyn_cast<omp::VersionAttr>(attr)) {
6190  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder =
6191  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
6192  ompBuilder->M.addModuleFlag(llvm::Module::Max, "openmp",
6193  versionAttr.getVersion());
6194  return success();
6195  }
6196  return failure();
6197  })
6198  .Case("omp.declare_target",
6199  [&](Attribute attr) {
6200  if (auto declareTargetAttr =
6201  dyn_cast<omp::DeclareTargetAttr>(attr))
6202  return convertDeclareTargetAttr(op, declareTargetAttr,
6203  moduleTranslation);
6204  return failure();
6205  })
6206  .Case("omp.requires",
6207  [&](Attribute attr) {
6208  if (auto requiresAttr = dyn_cast<omp::ClauseRequiresAttr>(attr)) {
6209  using Requires = omp::ClauseRequires;
6210  Requires flags = requiresAttr.getValue();
6211  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6212  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6213  config.setHasRequiresReverseOffload(
6214  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::reverse_offload));
6215  config.setHasRequiresUnifiedAddress(
6216  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::unified_address));
6217  config.setHasRequiresUnifiedSharedMemory(
6218  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::unified_shared_memory));
6219  config.setHasRequiresDynamicAllocators(
6220  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::dynamic_allocators));
6221  return success();
6222  }
6223  return failure();
6224  })
6225  .Case("omp.target_triples",
6226  [&](Attribute attr) {
6227  if (auto triplesAttr = dyn_cast<ArrayAttr>(attr)) {
6228  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6229  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6230  config.TargetTriples.clear();
6231  config.TargetTriples.reserve(triplesAttr.size());
6232  for (Attribute tripleAttr : triplesAttr) {
6233  if (auto tripleStrAttr = dyn_cast<StringAttr>(tripleAttr))
6234  config.TargetTriples.emplace_back(tripleStrAttr.getValue());
6235  else
6236  return failure();
6237  }
6238  return success();
6239  }
6240  return failure();
6241  })
6242  .Default([](Attribute) {
6243  // Fall through for omp attributes that do not require lowering.
6244  return success();
6245  })(attribute.getValue());
6246 
6247  return failure();
6248 }
6249 
6250 /// Given an OpenMP MLIR operation, create the corresponding LLVM IR
6251 /// (including OpenMP runtime calls).
6252 LogicalResult OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface::convertOperation(
6253  Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6254  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const {
6255 
6256  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
6257  if (ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice()) {
6258  if (isTargetDeviceOp(op)) {
6259  return convertTargetDeviceOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6260  } else {
6261  return convertTargetOpsInNest(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6262  }
6263  }
6264  return convertHostOrTargetOperation(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6265 }
6266 
6267 void mlir::registerOpenMPDialectTranslation(DialectRegistry &registry) {
6268  registry.insert<omp::OpenMPDialect>();
6269  registry.addExtension(+[](MLIRContext *ctx, omp::OpenMPDialect *dialect) {
6270  dialect->addInterfaces<OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface>();
6271  });
6272 }
6273 
6274 void mlir::registerOpenMPDialectTranslation(MLIRContext &context) {
6275  DialectRegistry registry;
6276  registerOpenMPDialectTranslation(registry);
6277  context.appendDialectRegistry(registry);
6278 }

findAllocaInsertPoint
